I have read on this Kindle just fine, but I prefer the size and screen of my Kindle e-reader for long stretches of reading.7. I would recommend setting up some parent controls, even if you are the only one using your Kindle. Once you turn on the controls you can go into the settings and choose the controls you want to use. For example, I want my Kindle to ask for a password before a purchase is made or a video is watched, just in case I accidentally hit a button or my kids happen to be using it.8 If for any reason you have to return your Kindle, I was  told by a customer service rep to deactivate the Kindle from your account for security reasons, even though the first thing Amazon does it delete all information on returned Kindles.9. I wish there was a charging indicator light. You plug the thing in and there is no way of knowing if it is charging or is fully charged.

Reviews.Title: The laptop of the future is here.
Reviews.Author: John Barry
Reviews.Content: HistoryWe've owned two original Kindle Fire's, a Kindle HD 8.9, Kindle HD 7" and now the Kindle HDX 8.9 64gig version.It is amazing. High resolution, fast and compatible with most of the apps on our cloud. We love it. We love having our books, movies (prime), music, games and apps all on the cloud. All accessible to our devices and smart phones.EmotionWe love it. By "we" I mean me, my wife and our 5 year old daughter, who has been using it since she was 3. She would have been using it earlier but we didn't have one.ConstructionIt is very thin, very fast and elegant. More-so than the HD version. The original Fire, which is highly functional, seems very primitive by comparison. Now one of our original Fire's broke. Amazon was kind enough to give us $75 credit on it. For this we are very grateful.FunctionalityMy wife is a Database developer and has resources that help her with her job.I am a musician. I have wonderful books, a 4 track mixer, can write notes, take video notes... browse the web, run apps, games, movies. it is beyond my wildest dreams and I am very impressed. At this stage in my life it takes a lot to impress me, but this has a lot.My daughter has tons of games (minecraft, reading apps, etc) that she adores. The worst thing is we have strive to limit her. Now the kindle will do that for us, but we still reserve the right to do that. She's very careful with her "Piggy" as she calls it. This is based on an early application (2 years back) that featured a "Piggy". Well, she loves it. We all call our kindles "Piggies" because of this.LongevityI don't know how it will hold up. I pray it will last years. I can see using it for years if it does. I can't imagine what Amazon's engineers will come up with in the coming years. It's yet another reason to fight to stay alive. I am amazed by technology. I rank this right up there with innovations such as the Kemper and almost the cell phone. It's just amazing and a game changer. IMHO, easily the leader in it's field.Tech SupportAmazon's tech support is top notch and second to none. They make a mistake they'll break their backs to fix it. If carriers make a mistake they do their best to make it right and then some. They don't have to, but this reinforces good-will and makes us come back to them time and time again. We love amazon. This product is tied to amazon and their success and quality shines through in this product. They deserve all of their success.Originality and other tabletsThere are many tablets on the market. The key competitor is the iPad and the two are very comparable. The iPad's keys to success are it's larger screen and it's elegant programs. It's weakness is it's cloud is too proprietary compared to the Kindle. I have two iTouches and like the elegant, well designed programs, but dislike iTunes. The Kindle beats the iPad in every other department. The Kindle HDX is less expensive, the programs are usually on par or close to Apple, and the resolution is actually higher on the HDX. The HDX also boast a faster quad core processor. This might be negated by the higher resolution of the Kindle but the difference is negligible.VerdictBoth. I would be happy with an iPad and a Kindle. If I had to choose one it would be the Kindle. Amazon has found a way to worm themselves into our lives and our hearts. Their relatively low priced kindle, great shipping, excellent selection of everything has done it. They are part of our culture with south park making episodes based on UPS/Amazon deliveries and so forth. It's a huge deal and probably the beginning of something larger than we can imagine. The only thing is, as Amazon grows, will it maintain it's integrity to itself and it's customers -- not sell out to corporate and powerful investors.

Reviews.Title: Video help
Reviews.Author: Johnny Kenehan "Johnny Kenehan"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kindle for my wife for Christmas; ordered it the 23rd and had it the 24th!  The unit is just unbelievably thin and sleek and it was fully charged out of the box.  It is an amazing unit, fast response, fantastic screen and then there is the live help.We had some problem getting the smtp settings right, just wouldn't work.  This is certainly not Amazon's issue, but an issue with finding the right settings for my internet provider.  In desperation, I thought I'd try the live help but I didn't hold out much hope, it was just before midnight on CHRISTMAS DAY!  After LESS THAN FIVE SECONDS after pushing the button, Deborah popped up in a little window and asked me how she could help.  I immediately looked to see if I had pants on ... but she said only I could see her!She was GREAT.  Took us about 10 minutes and I was up.  It was so cool seeing her draw on my screen and point to the needed settings.  I just could not believe the customer attention I got.  Damn, if I could give 10 stars I would!!!!  Amazon, you've really done it this time.  Even had the Kindle been less than stellar, I wouldn't have minded knowing my wife or I will always have the help we need.  BTW, YouTube videos played immediately and just as expected.  Well done Amazon, and "Deborah"!!!

Reviews.Title: A great improvement over the Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Judy L.
Reviews.Content: I am not going to repeat what has be expressed on other reviews, but will only tell you my opinion of the improvements over the Fire HD and compare to other tablets I have. If you want the tech specs, you can read them on the page for the tablet. So I won't repeat them here. I have and have had a number of tablets including the iPad AIR, iPad 3rd gen, iPad 7", Nexus 7, Nexus 7 2nd gen, Galaxy Note, Galaxy Note 3, Galaxy Note 8, and an Asus 10" (I don't remember the model). So I am very familiar with the different models and operating systems.I had a Kindle Fire Hd 7" that I sold because I didn't like the carousel, and getting to apps that I wanted to used wasn't convenient. The color, resolution, and sound were fine for my purposes to watch Amazon movies and to uses some apps, but it was cumbersome as compared to other android tablets that I had. Apps couldn't be grouped or organized as they could be on other tablets, and every app used was added to the carousel making the carousel lengthy and virtually useless.I decided to give the Kindle Fire HDX a try in hopes that some of the disappointments I experienced with the Fire HD were resolved. I have had the Kindle Fire HDX only a couple of days, but so far, I am impressed with the improvements. It still has the carousel, that can be useless if you use a number of apps or new apps are added - all are added to the carousel. Those that you don't use often have to be remove, one-by-one, manually. It would be nice if adding apps to the carousel was an option so that only most used apps could be added. (Hint to Amazon).On the plus side, you can now view all of your installed apps and execute them by swiping up in the screen. You can also group your apps into collections, or folders, and name the folders. In addition, apps in the apps view can be arranged in a way that makes sense to you by dragging and dropping them into position. In this matter, the Kindle Fire HDX function much more like other android tablets and is a huge improvement over previous versions of the Kindle Fire. This versions offers much more user control for organization and usage of the tablet.A couple other improvements that are obvious to me are the resolution and the crisp true colors. The colors on the screen really do "pop". In comparison to other tablets that I have, the touch response is extremely good, and the accuracy of the on-screen keyboard has been flawless. In addition, moving from the carousel to the apps screen and going from one app to another has been very smooth. There is no lag at all.I did have an opportunity access Mayday, that is reached by clicking the "?" icon. I used this at 3am, and go almost an immediate response. The representative was very helpful and answered all of my questions. I did find out that many of the Google apps are not compatible with the Kindle Fire HDX because developers have not made them compatible. They hope that this will change with future updates to the OS. In my experience, developers of apps have most developed the iPad apps and then the Google apps. The Google apps never seem to be quite as good as the iPad apps. Now that Amazon has developed  a very capable tablet, maybe developers will start to create more apps that are compatible. This is yet to be seen. In the meantime, users of the Kindle tablets are pretty much limited to apps available on Amazon other than a few Google apps that may be compatible.At this point, I would recommend the Kindle Fire HDX tor android flexibility, the improved display, and for use with Amazon Prime deals. I will update this review as I get more experience with the features of this device.

Reviews.Title: Impressive Improvement over KF HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Steward H.
Reviews.Content: While being very satisfied with our Kindle Fire HD 8.9, we were pleased to upgrade to the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 when Amazon offered the four payment plan. We purchased both of our Kindle Fire 8.9's with 32 GM of memory, without the special offers feature.We want to emphasize that the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 is a very fine tablet, and if you do not have the extra funds to purchase the HDX 8.9, you should purchase the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 while they are still available from Amazon for $229. The two are very close in the quality of still and video graphics. At this price, they are an incredible bargain.Nevertheless, we were very pleased (amazed might be a better term) by the new Kindle Fire HDX 8.9. In the following commentary, keep in mind we are comparing the HDX to the HD 8.9.The new HDX 8.9 is noticeably lighter to hold, yet retains the solid build quality of the original 8.9. As far as still graphics are concerned, the colors are more vivid, contrast is even higher, blacks appear even blacker. In short, the display is amazingly impressive!  Comparing the two tablets side by side, it is as if the original image is being viewed through a very slight polarizing filter on the original HD 8.9.As far as viewing Video content, we noticed very little difference between the two tablets, with the original KF HD 8.9 perhaps having a slight edge. Both are excellent, movie picture quality varies widely. If you are a Prime member, try The Robe, or Contact if you want to see just how good the video quality truly is. The soundtrack on Contact showcases the sound quality possible with these tablets.The rear/back facing camera is fun to use, color is quite accurate. The camera is effective in relatively low light situations with low "noise". If high picture quality is required, we would recommend using your digital camera.The sound quality seems to be slightly better on the new model, which might be due to the altered position of the dual speakers. If you are watching a movie, you will definitely want to use high quality lightweight headphones. With these, the sound quality is very impressive.The New Silk browser is greatly improved.  Internet browsing is significantly faster with snappy response.Battery life is significantly improved, we noticed at least a 20% increase in useable battery life.Overall, the new Kindle FIre HDX 8.9 has managed to improve an already excellent screen image,  provide slightly better sound, added a useful rear/back facing camera, while being significantly lighter in weight.There really isn't anything we would describe as being negative with this tablet. Some icons, apps, and text appear slightly smaller in size because of the increased screen resolution, and one of our apps did not run properly on the new Kindle fire. If a reset is required, one must now depress the power button for a full 20 seconds, release, and repress the button to allow the kindle to reset. We only experienced one lockup requiring a reset, which we are sure was software related.If Amazon is still offering the four payment plan, there is no better time to purchase or upgrade. If not, we still are impressed enough to spend the full $444 for the 32G KF HDX 8.9, without special offers. (If you opt for 16GB and special offers, the price is less). You will not regret purchasing this item!

Reviews.Title: Best Kindle so far!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have been a Kindle user since the 1st generation readers came out, I have followed successive generations through all the iterations except the KIndle HD as I had helped a friend with one and really didn't like the weight, I had a 10.9 Android tablet that didn't weight anymore than her little 7 inch.  However, I had seen some of the reviews referring to how light the HDX was and my husband was like, well my little tech junky would you like that for Christmas. I of course did some research on the forums and said yes.  Now, one caveat, if you get frustrated with not being able to get a specific app you really want, be sure to go to the forums, I have not yet found an app that I couldn't get one way or another so I'm very happy with this light little unit.  I streamed a video or two from Amazon Prime without downloading and no hiccups or pauses, I was amazed at the image quality.  So, if you do your homework to make sure you can get the apps you want, then I would highly recommend this speedy, light, amazing graphics tablet.

Reviews.Title: Smaller screen than the iPad but far better in other areas
Reviews.Author: Vamsi P.
Reviews.Content: I was not sure about the Kindle HDX and almost bought the iPad Air but glad I got the Kindle instead. The screen is slightly smaller compared to iPad but Kindle is far better option especially if you have kids and if you want to use the device for media. I love the integration with Amazon Prime, Parental Controls are awesome and like the app store as well. I can say for sure, i am not  missing anything so far that I had with the iPad and this is a  great tablet  for both adults and kids.

Reviews.Title: Comments on the Kindle book experience; not interested in HDX as a Tablet
Reviews.Author: Lit teacher
Reviews.Content: This HDX is just ok. But for being a primary book reader for their kindle books, there are a couple of serious flaws for the dedicated kindle reader that enjoys the digital version as well as the audio version. With their "Immersion Reading" `which isthe digital book along with the professional narration; I get skips in the highlighting and the highlighting not keeping up with the narration; seems to depend on the book and/or the size of the text you've selected; also if you're reading in double columns or not.Text To Speech;Even tho they have now included 6 voices only 2 of these are US English; Amazon needs to have many more choices and better quality voices like the Neospeech voices. The Text To Speech is also flawed in that it will skip pages (not the audio); the written text will skip ahead of the audio; it's a pain then to page back because you have start all over at the beginning of the page; sometimes it will get halfway into a page; then the page will jump to the next page or even 2 pages ahead.I have talked to Mayday and have also talked to their regular support staff about these issues. Nobody knows what to do about these or how to fix them.They need to have highlighting with the Text To Speech and better highlighting where you can change the colors of the highlighting.I had the HD also (the 2012 Kindle Fire); I had the same problems with it.Narration along with the digital is a great idea, but it needs to work better.

Reviews.Title: No HDMI port
Reviews.Author: Tammy
Reviews.Content: I ordered this unit to replace my current Kindle Fire HD which has 32 GB. The new Fire boasts 64 GB (without having to go 4G) and is a bit smaller and lighter. However, I am returning it unused as Amazon decided to NOT include the micro HDMI port that the previous model has. I use the tablet to (among other things) download Amazon videos. How is the whole family supposed to watch without the ability to connect to a larger screen. Shall we all huddle around the tablet. Considering the SIGNIFICANT price difference between the HD and HDX, I'd expect it to do all that the previous model did and MORE.

Reviews.Title: Gorgeous Picture Kindle…Get it.
Reviews.Author: Leanne
Reviews.Content: If you are NOT a fan of a HUGE HEAVY iPAD, get the BIG kindle -its NOT too heavy to hold with one lady's hand to read a book - its just fine. Putting a cover on it will make it heavy, so use a sleeve. I bought an Otter Box and may use it to give to my child, but so far I haven't bothered to put it on - but I did buy the 2 year Canopy Insurance/Protection plan - for a 600+ dollar item its worth it to insure. I got the top of the line, 64G 4G Kindle, and love it. Using AT&T;, the Share plan or whatever its called between iPhone plus Kindle - my monthly plan is virtually the SAME PRICE split between 2 devices - not hardly a penny more, for top of the line plan, so its not even an extra cost- which is great, my monthly bill is about $135 for cell and now for cell + Kindle. the Kindle picture is gorgeous. Its like watching the best little TV you ever bought, incredibly high quality viewing.It was NOT ready/charged right out of the box, but big deal, it charged quickly. Had a bit of trouble, needed a couple resets but Amazon CUSTOMER SERVICE was RIGHT THERE for chat plus then phone help and when they say 24/7, they mean it! There was NO wait and no issue with any language barrier with the reps on the phone - very courteous, helpful, and quickly resolved the setup issue- I was very pleased w/Amazon's service and was able to enjoy the Kindle quickly.LOTS of FREE games for kids plus adults - a HUGE plus, totally worth getting AMAZON PRIME for, free shipping, etc with the 80/annual fee. I am sure I will get my $$$ worth on Prime membership with all the available movies, TV, books, and free shipping on so many items. I probably already have just with Christmas shopping.  Just started using it within the last week so can't comment on all its features/apps available, but so far, incredibly happy -only disliked waiting a few weeks to get it on pre-order!I use iPhone 5S and had 4, etc, but Apple is quickly losing my interest in terms of super premium cost and entertainment content - Amazon wins me for night/weekend attention, and my employer is still a PC-shop, I only have a Mac laptop for personal computer use. Do NOT question getting the "big" Kindle - its not too big to hold one-handed or slip in a medium-size purse - its amazingly light-don't bother with the smaller one unless you're a guy and don't use a "Murse" or backpack or briefcase- treat yourself. Merry and Happy!

Reviews.Title: Don't Hesitate, Buty This Tablet Now!
Reviews.Author: Guardsix
Reviews.Content: This Is a great tablet.  I had the Nexus 7 (2013) and I returned it and bought the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9.  I love the bigger screen.  It is by far the best screen I have ever looked at including the new Nexus 7.  I have an IPad mini (non-retina) and that's been my reader of choice until this KFHDX arrived.  The letters on screen are crystal sharp and so easy to read.  Pictures are amazingly brilliant even the ones I take with my own camera or cell phone.  I don't plan to take many pictures with this tablet but it's got a good camera built in both front and back so it's there if I ever need it.Right now, I have my old Logitech Bluetooth Tablet Keyboard linked with my KFHDX and it works just great.  I couldn't get this keyboar to work with my old Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 which I also sold in favor of this Kindle Tablet.  Yeah, I know I'm somewhat stuck with the Amazon Play Store but there are ways around that and the Amazon Play Store isn't all that bad, I mean, how many apps do you really need or use?If you're debating on whether to buy this or not, do buy it.  You won't be sorry.  It is so light that you'll wonder why every other tablet availabe is so heavy!  The only thing that puzzels me, is how Amazon is going to make this better in their next iteration?  Doesn't seem possible.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet
Reviews.Author: Spero Constantine
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and my first Kindle. I usually buy Apple products but I was intrigued with the marketing campaign by Amazon. I am a marketing professional so I appreciate it when a company goes the extra mile with a quality campaign. I spent three months comparing the different options and ended up with two; iPad Air and Kindle HDX 8.9. I think the iPad Air is Nirvana, it is made with such quality that it has a museum piece. I feel. the only problem is that I am so familiar with Apple products that it was too familiar, just like what I work on every day. The Kindle on the other hand was new and different and that made it interesting to me. I then decided to see which company wanted my business more.....Apple offered no discounts and Amazon offered a payment plan plus had a special that week for Prime members. Plus when I went to the Best Buy to give them both a try the Apple rep was arrogant and rude. I read all the customer reviews for the Kindle on the Amazon site so I was familiar with all the major complaints i.e., no access to Google Docs and Google Play and Google Apps store. I learned all about side loading the google apps via Mobile 1 app etc. These learnings really helped shape my decision because I knew that it was not a plain old Google Android based device and I was glad because that was what made this Kindle interesting....it was daring to be different. I actually like the Silk Browser, I like the way that Youtube works on it and yes, I can sign into Youtube and have access to all my channels and subscriptions (may have been an issue in the past but not anymore). I side loaded Chrome and yes it does not work exactly like it should but it allows me to use Google Maps with GPS so it knows my location. I use the Kindle at work and can do everything that I want with my Exchange Active Sync Email for my corporate email and I use the Office Suite Pro for word, excel, powerpoint and adobe PDFs. I use the Amazon Cloud Drive for storage and Amazon Cloud Player for transferring my music from my laptop. The issue with the Cloud Drive is that you can only stream videos that are less than 20 minutes from the Cloud Drive onto your Kindle (don't know why they limit that and wish they would not). I bought the 16GB version thinking that I could upgrade my Cloud Drive account and store everything on it but the video limitation is a problem. That is the reason that I only gave this tablet 4 stars. Otherwise, I love the functionality of the Kindle and the Amazon ecosystem for my books, magazines, movies, tv shows, music, Prime Membership, shopping etc...it makes life much easier and convenient.

Reviews.Title: I love it.  Goes everywhere with me now
Reviews.Author: Scott(y) "Scott Van Tussenbrook"
Reviews.Content: I've been window-shopping for a tablet for a few months, and I've had my Kindle Fire HDX for a couple of weeks now.  I'm just going to respond to some points that seem to keep cropping up in reviews.The App StoreSince I spent more than six seconds researching this before I bought it, I already knew the Amazon App Store wasn't Google Play, and that there would be apps missing.  I'm a heavy Google user -- Gmail, Maps, Voice, all of it.  I still don't miss these functions on my Kindle.  Why?  Because I have all that on my PHONE, and I'm not trying to have my Kindle just be the same device I already have, just bigger.  Apps that are missing are handled ably by replacements.  The native Mail/Calendar/Contacts apps are functional if simple, and they stay perfectly synced with my Google info.  It's not Gmail but it works.  All the other apps I wanted WERE available and work fantastic -- Evernote, Netflix, HBO GO, Pandora, Goodreads, etc.  Disappointed that the Facebook app is just a shell around the mobile FB website, but all the other apps are the real thing.BluetoothYes it does come with Bluetooth, and yes it works great.  I spent the weekend streaming music from my Kindle to a Bose Soundlink and it worked perfectly nonstop.GPSIf you get the 4G model (I have Verizon), you do get GPS.  No Google Maps, but Waze is in the App Store and works just as well, for turn-by-turn nav and everything.  (My only beef here is with Verizon charging me a $35 "activation charge" to add the Kindle to my account, which I did by myself, online.  $35 charge anyway.  Thanks, phone company.)Origami coverI got the blue Origami cover/case.  It looks fantastic, and works fine for what it says it does.  It is a bit heavy, but the device is only held in with magnets so if you want to take it out for holding and reading it's super easy.  Buttons for power and volume are mirrored exactly with buttons on the case.  It's way overpriced, but it's a perfect match for the device.ChargerI bought the $19,99 "fast charger," not knowing that the exact same one comes with it in the box.  (Buyer beware.)  One thing that did make me go "huh" was, while it was plugged in, I got a "you are using a low-voltage charger, if using your device while charging the battery may still drain," etc. message.  It doesn't act like a low-voltage charger -- charges all the way up from dead in just a few hours, EVEN while you are using it.  Not sure what that message was about.Now, on to the good stuff:Reading books (Kindle)This is my first e-reader/tablet of any kind, so I don't have anything else to compare it to, but the Kindle Fire makes reading books an unexpected pleasure.  I chewed through an entire novel in one day, last weekend.  I like the ability to look up words, make highlights and notes to go back to, and the X-Ray feature is interesting, not as much fun as for TV/Movies (more on that in a minute) but still provides some fun trivia/info.  I don't notice any blue or purple haze anywhere on the screen, edges or otherwise.  Apparently they have taken care of that issue.  (And IMHO the beige/sepia color scheme is more comfortable for reading than black/white anyway.)MusicPlaying music is no-frills, but solid.  I have all my music in Amazon's Cloud player ($25/year).  This is the first time since the old-school iPods with the giant hard drives, that I have been able to "bring my whole collection with me."  Not literally, since 90% of it lives in the cloud, but between the Wi-Fi and the 4G for when I'm not in a usual haunt, same difference.  The X-Ray for music isn't as useful to me, mostly it shows you song lyrics, and most of my music is indie/DJ/mixtape/etc so Amazon doesn't have the sing-a-long lyrics for much of it.Movies/TV"Competitors:"  Netflix, HBO GO, Hulu+ all work seamlessly and look beautiful.  They're not kidding about the screen on this thing -- I know I have old eyes, but I seriously cannot even see pixels, even when trying to.  It's like the picture is smoother than in real life.  The picture is so good it is *almost* too much.  I have 1080p TV's at home and the Kindle Fire HDX is starting to make them look grainy by comparison.  I really can't say enough good things about the picture quality.  Held up next to an iPad Air there is no comparison -- the Kindle wins hands down.  Here is where I really do like the X-Ray.  I like to re-watch movies and TV shows, and with X-Ray activated, everyone currently in scene on the screen, appears to the left, in a selectable list that takes you to that person's IMDB bio.  I can't be the only one who watches shows and wonders, "Where else have I seen him/her..."  Well now that info is a click away.  (X-Ray only works with content streamed or purchased from Amazon.)  One note regarding downloading videos -- I got the 64 GB version (just in case), and I find it takes FOR EVER to download movies, especially HD but even the regular ones really seem to take their time.  If you're going on a plane trip and are wanting to bring a few downloaded movies with you, be prepared to queue them up and then let it spend the whole day downloading.  This is true regardless of where I'm connected -- including at work, where we have the fastest internet known to mankind -- so I don't think it's a network issue.  Either Amazon is throttling movie downloads or these files really do just take forever to download, but it ALMOST makes the ability to download seem beside the point.  It's just as fast an easy to stream them instead.  If I had it to do over again I would probably just stick with 32 GB.ConclusionYes, this device is basically a very fancy, window-dressed portal to your purchasing and consuming Amazon stuff.  This is not a secret.  I went with the Kindle over a pure-Google/Android Samsung or something or the iPad, because I'm already invested in Amazon's "ecosystem."  I'm a Prime member, and I've had Amazon VoD on my Roku for years now, so I have a medium-sized collection of purchased videos.  I uploaded my whole music library as well.  If you're just as heavily invested in iTunes/Apple stuff then you may feel there's something lacking, just like I would have, had I bought an iPad.  As it is, as soon as I logged in with my account on the Kindle, there was all of my stuff.  Boom.  The "pure Android" Google tablets, I didn't even consider.  As I said at the top, I bought the Kindle fire *because* it was not trying to be a clone of my phone.  (And I don't like the Google media apps that I *have* tried to use -- Google Play Music on my phone is glitchy, crashy, and I don't like the interface.)  This device is for reading books, listening to music, and watching movies.  Yes, preferably (and easily) from Amazon.  I don't think anyone is making a secret of this.  I don't need to be able to edit Excel spreadsheets.  (That's what the laptop is for.)  I don't need Google Maps (that's what my phone is for.)  What this device does, it does very, VERY well.I just priced iPads on Apples's site and the iPad air, similarly configured to my Kindle (64GB, 4G Wireless + GPS) is $829.  I paid $539 for the Kindle.  For a difference nearly $300, I can put up with looking at an advertisement for 2 seconds while I flip open the cover.  (I can't believe people complain about those ads.  You can get rid of them by paying the $15 -- even if you've bought one with ads, the "upgrade" is simple.)No, this is not "just like the iPad," and it is not a clone of the Google Nexus, and neither is it trying to be either of those things.  I love it, and I could not be happier with my purchase.Quick update/additionTwo things I forgot to mention above:Silk web browserWorks fine for me, even when browsing my school's eCollege website, which is famously glitchy - looks just as good as on my computer.  And the "reading mode" (where it clears away all the artwork and clutter and leaves only text, Kindle book-style) is a game changer.  Love it.GamesI am not at all a big gamer, but since they give you a bunch of Amazon coin credits, I decided to give it a whirl.  GT Racing 2 is too much fun, and The Room is fun and interesting and relaxing in a weird way.  Among many others.  I didn't get this device to play games on, specifically, but that has quickly become one of my favorite things about it.  The thing is basically just a toy for grown-ups.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely the best - especially on a cruise ship!
Reviews.Author: Travelcat
Reviews.Content: A week after receiving the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9", we took it on a cruise.WiFi is difficult at best at sea but the Kindle out-performed all of its' competition.Passengers with other tablets lined up in the computer room to get help as they kept having the signal drop.  I did not have that problem.  I later spoke with the computer guru on the ship and was told that the most popular tablet keeps some things running in the background - almost indefinitely which shows it down considerably.I used the Kindle for emails, surfing the web, taking photographs and playing games.  The photographs came out amazingly well.  As soon as I got back on the ship to get a WiFi signal, it was easy to send the photos to my friends and family.  If there is one weakness in the Kindle, it is that the button you touch to take a picture is a bit sensitive.  Several times I ended up taking the same picture 3-4 times.Another very important thing for a non-technical user like myself is how easy it is to use.  I have tried using the major competitor's tablet several times and found it complicated.  I needed something that was straightforward.  Kindle met that requirement as well as many more.  While I still need to learn more in order to use the Kindle features to the fullest, I am 100% pleased with the ease of use and how many things I was able to do with one device.

Reviews.Title: impressive
Reviews.Author: ka
Reviews.Content: I have a Samsung 10.1 galaxy note myself and I consider it to be the best tablet out there. However I purchased this kindle 8.9 HDX for my 22 year old tech savvy son for Christmas and he enjoys it very much.  His friends were all so impressed they want their own.Before wrapping, I set it up for him. I downloaded 1mobile market so that he could have snapchat and instagram and all those great google play apps. The cameras take gorgeous pictures and videos. It was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: where have you been all my life!
Reviews.Author: Downs
Reviews.Content: Lo v e  ItI have not put it downDoes everythingBooksVideoEmailWeb browsingPicturesSkypeSmall enough to take anywhere and screen big enough to enjoy & "see" what ever I am doing

Reviews.Title: Better Than Anticipated
Reviews.Author: VELMA CRAWFORD
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my Kindle HDX 8.9, and so happy that I decided to purchase the top of the line . I can now read my favorite books at night without turning all the lights on. The Kindle and all its features are the best. I highly recommend that you purchase  a cover or the Otter Box to protect the Kindle. It is very lightweight, easy to care and store in your purse or bag. However, it can be easily damaged if dropped or not handled properly.

Reviews.Title: I know I made the best decision on this product
Reviews.Author: Iris McElroy
Reviews.Content: After reviews from many sources, I choose to purchase another Kindle Fire HDX. This is my 3 kindle product. The first was the reader, then the Fire 7" and now I'm sold on the HDX 8.9". I highly recommend this product because of the price, quality, and it has all that I need to make me happy. The product stands on it own. I donated my 7" Fire to a senior who is enjoying her first toy of the 21 century. The quality of the color, sound and pictures are excellent. A well invested product.

Reviews.Title: Great!!
Reviews.Author: Alberto Barraza
Reviews.Content: Will be purchasing this soon - amazing Trial experience. In my opinion it is better than the IPAD.The camera is amazing!

Reviews.Title: A WINNER!
Reviews.Author: Don McKeefery "micker61"
Reviews.Content: I have been shopping for a new "device" to replace my Kindle DX.  I was looking for something with more versatility, and that fits my lifestyle.  This is it!The screen resolution is superb!  The size is just right!  And, the features are spot on!I spent a few hours setting it up and loading on some familiar apps, as well as some new ones.  I found the ease of locating and loading to be intuitive.  In fact, everything about the device seems intuitive...which is something that concerned me at first since it is more than just an e-reader!Did I mention the blazing speed?  It's as if the device is reading my mind and is already queuing the next app that I want to open and use.  You no sooner touch the screen and your app is open and ready for use!  This concerned me with some of the other devices I looked at.  Blazing fast!!I would, and will, recommend this device to everyone who is looking for a feature-rich device.

Reviews.Title: i'm glad i bought it.
Reviews.Author: garyhere "garyhere"
Reviews.Content: i'm a 65 year old computer literate, but a smart phone android Luddite. i am pleased with this tablet. i had a fire hd last year i sent back because i was not happy with the performance. this is totally different. it is fast! almost as fast as my hard wired desktop. the touch screen is accurate. i don't think i've had to double tap anything. it activates the wanted icon and not the icon next to the one you want. all apps seem to operate smoothly, though i mostly use it for reading. the reading screen is adequate and, other then some glare, it is easy on the eyes. the browser is really quick. i use it mostly for reading and checking the web for questions i have about anything that comes up. the battery lasts forever. i have never run it down past 50% even after 8 hours of mixed use. while reading it seems to use almost no power. the screen is the best i've ever seen on any tablet. AND IT"S LIGHT!!! it weighs less than half of what my 7 inch original fire weighs. easy to hold and read for hours. the miracast works seamlessly without any digital skip or sound delay on netflicks and youtube. why not five stars? the mail app does not let you "select all" and delete more than one email at a time. there are a few other minor software glitches that i presume will be fixed. when downloading from usb to documents file as instructed i get a message that i can't download to that location, but when i reopen the unit the download shows up? . bottom line i'm glad i bought it.

Reviews.Title: Loving this so far!
Reviews.Author: Shrubbin Cole
Reviews.Content: I've been playing around with this tablet for about 2 or three weeks now!I love it so far, it's so light and portable compared to my other devices!PRO: Really good video quality and image quality --surprisingly nice back AND front camera o-o - lighter than my coworkers iPad air, what? o.o-- Built in surround sound on such a thin device? Super impressive. I was about to download and play movies with no issues for a 7 hour trip without the device dying. O.o -  Good for entertainment value: there's instant downloads of any amazon instant streaming device! There's also local storage.-- very responsive, not laggy, easy to learn and pick up-instant unlimited tech support that can annotate your screen to show you how to use the device-comes with free perks from amazon wish coins so you get some free credit--easy to sync across platforms! (You can do it via USB or there's Kindle syncing programs)--Battery lasts surprisingly long! I left it out for a few days and didn't bring it with me to school or to workand the device would still be on! If only my phone could last more than 5 hours...--This is running MOJITO which is android based and I'm really surprised how easy everything is to set up. No syncing issues, no email issues, i only had one issue with the cloud but logging out and logging back in worked. (hah)Cons--Limited app market (a lot of normally free apps don't exist, or are third party...) the most common ones are there like Facebook, Evernote, and Skype is Built in!-- NO SD? :( No expanded storage, but there's tons of streaming services.-- No Timer on the camera? I guess I need a third party app, but I actually use this feature a lot. >.<--Silk? I couldn't find dolphin in the store if it runs android... but it looks like it's getting updates. It's usability is a bit limited but you can do bookmarks, tabs, and all that stuff. It gets stuff done!--this is insignificant but is it really remarkable that the product comes with the charger?-- No Chromecast support! I wasn't able to set it up with an AppleTV either. :\Amazon's working on this device but they're definitely going in the right direction. :) It's a great entertainment device that's worth the value!To be honest is this item is not towards my demographic (I use network services and need a productive tablet, having only open office with limited interal storage and dropbox kinda scares me.) but all of my relatives love it!I'm keeping it anyway for my  parents as they picked it up right away. :) Even if I'm not home, the mayday button can show them how to do the same things!

Reviews.Title: Its My Best Friend, sorta
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Have loved all my Kindles and love this too.  The clarity of the screen is AAA rated.  So sharp.  I haven't tried the SOS yet but nice to know its there.  Love the speed of the processor and its ease of picking up wifi signals.  My only complaints are that they left off the mini HDMI port and I had just bought a cable to use it for my previous Kindle HD.  I had to buy another device and cable to make use of the mirroring to a TV screen to watch my Prime shows.  Also the buttons on the back rather than the edge make it quite inconvenient when you have a case/cover for your device and the front flap is open and wrapped around the back.  Come on Amazon/Kindle.  Run this stuff past some test people!  Overall though, you couldn't pry it out of my hands.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle HDX 8.9.  I have the original Kindle Fire 7" to compare it to.The only problem I'm having with the HDX 8.9 is that it doesn't hold a charge for long.  The first one I ordered came and was fine for 3 weeks and then I started using the camera and had the pictures on the carousel.  Then the battery would drain even while just sitting and not being used overnight or in the daytime.  It will drop 50% just sitting there asleep.Amazon replaced the first one with another HDX 8.9 and it seems to do the same.Issues seemed to begin when I started using the camera and having pictures on it.Now I don't keep any pics on the carousel and it helps but doesn't solve the problem.Battery does not hold a charge no matter what I do.  I only use it for short periods of time through the day, do not play games and don't Skype or anything.  Probably at the most 1.5 a day total and the battery drops about 50%.Otherwise I love my Kindle HDX for ease and convenience.Only wish the battery would hold a charge longer.  I can't imagine it lasting the 10 hours that they are talking about when using it.  It drains just sitting doing nothing.

Reviews.Title: Superb!
Reviews.Author: MarkMT
Reviews.Content: I've now had my HDX 8.9 for a month and after a couple of little hiccups I'm totally loving it. The screen is gorgeous, the user interface is very easy to use, the speed of the device is very snappy, it charges pretty quickly with the wall charger provided and the apps I'm using are great.In the first few days I had a problem with the device spontaneously rebooting and I was NOT happy. But a few days later Amazon pushed out a software update and about a day later I had a weird issue that led me to doing a factory reset. I'm not sure whether the original problem was with the Fire software or perhaps a rogue app I had installed, but everything is working fine now and I couldn't be happier.---Update: this review has apparently been classified with the 16GB Fire HDX 8.9, but I actually have the 64GB version. As I said, I couldn't be happier. I am also glad that I got the 64GB version - I initially started downloading movies at the top resolution (1080p I think) and it actually didn't take me too long to run out of storage after less than half a dozen downloads. I'm now using the medium quality (720p), which is perfectly fine and typically 2-2.5GB each.

Reviews.Title: THIS IS MY NEW BEST FRIEND!
Reviews.Author: terry lanning
Reviews.Content: I have never been much of a tech person but  I don't leave home without my Kindle.  In this world of hurry up and wait it is so very nice to always have something to occupy your time.  I can read, play games, check my e-mail or watch a movie or tv show that I missed.  You can't beat the picture quality, well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Amazon did it again! We love the Kindle HDX 8.9" in our house!
Reviews.Author: Venus2471
Reviews.Content: The only con I find in this is I wish the battery time was longer.  I would recommend ordering a case and stylus at the same time you do the Kindle HDX.  I work better with a stylus then I do my stubby fingers.  I am not tech savvy but so far so good. I love the May Day button. I was a little freaked out the first time I used it thinking the Amazon tech could see me sitting in my PJ's with my hair a mess the same way I could see him. I quickly found out that wasn't the case. LOL...relief!  I've had it a few day's and have no real complaints thus far. The only problem I have had is having to hunt it down because family members keep stealing it from me. I would highly recommend this as a gift for yourself or someone special to you that likes to read books & magazines, use the internet, watch movies, listen to music, etc.  I just begun to tap into all the neat functions this device has. To me, tablets & ecspecially Kindle's, are the best new technological devices that have come out in awhile. My first was a Kindle Keyboard that I got for really cheap thru gathering points on another web site and this is my second. I do get the extended warranty but did not use it with my first Kindle. I did get it again with this one only because I began to have problems with the Kindle Keyboard after my warranty expired. I can't complain because it was heavily used & abused...LOL...I love Amazon's Kindles and the price is right for what I need it for. I do recommend getting the 8.9" because the size is just right to me.  I hope you enjoy it as much as we do ours!

Reviews.Title: Thumbs up for the Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: Paul Hysen "book owl"
Reviews.Content: The display on this device is amazing. There is no pixelation, even under a magnifier. This makes it very easy on the eyes. It is light and no burden to carry wherever you go and the battery lasts quite a while between charges, for a device of this nature. As you do not need a light to read by, it is the best book to take to bed. The wifi works great and eBooks are downloaded quickly. The interface works well and there are no obvious bugs. The book reader side of the Kindle Fire is as-easy-as and once a wifi connection has been established, you are set to go. My only criticism is that setting up the device can be a little confusing and at times frustratingly challenging, even for a seasoned computer user like myself. But I guess that is due to its Linux based Android operating systems, the inner workings of which only a seasoned Linux user would find anything less than esoteric. So some work on that aspect please Amazon, calling the help line is great, but the success of a device as regards the ease of setting it up, should be measured in the lack of calls, not its volume. But as far as the Kindle Fire HDX as a book reader is concerned, it's the Rolls Royce of readers, there is no better.

Reviews.Title: Love the Kindle Fire!
Reviews.Author: Syreeta Brown
Reviews.Content: It's east to use, fairly lightweight, and I can take it with me anywhere and pull it out whenever I need it. It also works better with some apps than my phone does. Love it!

Reviews.Title: Amazon has done it again
Reviews.Author: Tom Henderson "musician in my mind"
Reviews.Content: I have the kindle touch and the first kindle fire and had no issues with them so when the HDX was announced I decided that an upgrade was due.  I received my HDX two weeks earlier than first promised and it has been better than expected.

Reviews.Title: kindle 8.9
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Carter "cartec"
Reviews.Content: I have owned three devices over the past ten years and this by far the best.  I know there are other pads, smart phones and readers to choose from but think any of them compare to the speed,  convenience, and ease the new kindle fire 8.9.

Reviews.Title: Amazon Kindle Fire HDX 8.9", HDX Display, WI-FI, 64 GB - Includes Special Offers
Reviews.Author: Vicky Bolen OHara "Kindle Lover"
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HDX 8.9", HDX Display, Wi-Fi, 64 GB with special Offers.  The problems I've encountered are with wi-fi.  Sometimes, I like working on my tablet, and sometimes, I like working on my Chrome Book (which I also purchased at Amazon).I think I have found the solution to the problem.  When I'm working on my Kindle HDX Tablet, I have to completely unplug my Chrome Book.  It worked last night, and today my Chrome Book is working fine, when I plugged it back in.  This might be a solution for Amazon's Customer Service if anyone calls in with the same problem.  Meanwhile, I had to spend more dollars with my internet people for a Wi-Fi Extender.  The Wi-Fi extender is mine to keep, so I've elected to keep it. However, if anyone has a problem with different devices vying for their Wi-Fi, this is the solution--completely unplug one device before using another device.As I said before, I Love, Love, Love, my new Kindle Fire Tablet. :-)

Reviews.Title: BEST KINDLE EVER!!!
Reviews.Author: Forest Fun
Reviews.Content: More powerful, faster, out of this world pix, front & rear camera, great sound on & on, but best of all is having Amazon at your side. May day!!!!  My few problems have been operator stupidity & were handled cheerfuly.  I  Iove Amazon !!!

Reviews.Title: Great - lighter than any of the earlier Kindle Fire's and only one ounce heavier than the smaller I-Pad Mini
Reviews.Author: SAM
Reviews.Content: Lightweight, on/off and volume buttons flat on the back, better definition on most game screens - I have the original Kindle Fire, and the second version with the larger screen and still use them both, but the 8.9" with the HDX display really does have improvements over the last version.  I also have an I-Pad Mini which is not as easy to use and I have had to call their Help desk multiple times because of problems accessing features and starting apps.  I have never had to call Help for any of the Kindle Fires I have because I could always find an answer in the pre-loaded Guide.

Reviews.Title: Amazing tech, but deserves some hesitancy
Reviews.Author: Brian Real
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo1VSXOSX3IV21A', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo1VSXOSX3IV21AloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html/ref=cm_ciu_vr_mo1VSXOSX3IV21A/182-0755328-2367603?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo1VSXOSX3IV21AcurrentClick) { return cv_mo1VSXOSX3IV21AcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 2:21 MinsThe tech behind the HDX 8.9 is amazing and completely lives up to any and all hype. However, I have had some hiccups with service quality worth noting.The big issue is that the device would not download anything a couple of days ago, with everything just hanging in the queue. I hit the Mayday button, and someone eventually called me back. This was the second time I used Mayday, and the second time I was shifted over to someone else on a different platform. So, to be clear: Mayday is not a tech support service, but what you use when you can't figure out how to crop an image or something else simple. Considering the considerable amount of promotion around instant customer service via Mayday, this is a massive limitation and is the reason for one of the missing stars in this review.I received a phone call from an Amazon rep immediately after getting off the line with the Mayday rep, and this phone interaction lasted more than an hour. He made an earnest effort to help, but it actually made the problem worse. See the attached video - which I made for an earlier and considerably different draft of this review - to see what happened. I actually lost access to my book library. I eventually fixed this myself, by resetting to factory default. But, this then required more than an hour of re-customizing my device.On top of this, five graphic novels I purchased for the Kindle are only downloading in low-resolution files, making them look outright blurry. This appears to be a software issue, since a service rep was able to download higher res files to his device. It is automatically pushing these five - and just these five - titles to my device in inferior quality. I did both a Mayday call and an e-mail about this about two weeks ago, with no resolution, and no follow-up until yesterday.A very friendly customer service rep called me last night and took notes on both the major problem that led to the reset, and the graphic novel issue. He is still researching the latter.I hope that these are temporary issues that are just coming with a new launch and that I will be able to add another star to this review soon. However, until I can get content I paid for at a reasonable quality and go a few more weeks without having to reset my device (note: I never had to reset my original model Kindle Fire in two years of ownership), I am hesitant to enthusiastically recommend this, despite the awesome hardware.Note: This review is almost completely rewritten from the original post, reflecting some responses from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Light, Thin, an iPad contender
Reviews.Author: Chow
Reviews.Content: What an improvement over the Kindle Fire HD! First impression was, Oh my God! its so light! lol A real contender in competing with the Apple iPad Air. Light, thin, and very responsive. Some folks have complained about a light blue haze around the border of the display frame, but I dont see it on mine. I bought the 32GB wi fi model and the price difference from a comparable Apple product is a difference of $150 savings. Audible.com is owned by Amazon now so your audible books are instantly available from the cloud. Sound is very good. Reading books, superb. Gmail, oh yeah. My favorite apps like Evernote, Pandora, PBS videos, Twitter, Facebook, mulitle News channels, and of course Amazon movies rental are all there.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd 8.9 was way better. mayday is for how-to not tech support.
Reviews.Author: James A. Miller
Reviews.Content: I have had nothing but problems from this. It constantly looses internet while my old hd does not. They can be side by side on WiFi, and my new HDX will just drop the WiFi connection. I then have to hard reboot it to regain connectivity. Turning WiFi on and off does not work. It does this with any hotspot or WiFi location.  Also, while camping, non of my downloaded content would work. May day told me it was because I did not have an internet connection.... WHILE I WAS TALKING TO HIM ON THE KINDLE. I was then told to de register and re download 50 gigs of content... again. I am very disappointed. This is the first time I have been disappointed in an Amazon product.

Reviews.Title: Lack of HDMI Out is the only drawback from previous generation Kindle FIre HD
Reviews.Author: jbates
Reviews.Content: Everything is superior to my previous Kindle Fire HD 7" with one exception.  The lack of an HDMI out port is a glaring omission from an otherwise stellar product.  I can't take it on trips with me and use it in my hotel on the TV anymore.  The 8.9 screen is wonderful while on the plane or in a car but in the hotel room you want to plop down and relax not try and hunch over a little tablet screen wearing headphones.

Reviews.Title: First Impressions
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "Ex Libris Vita"
Reviews.Content: This is an upgrade from my 7" Kindle Fire HD that I've been using for about a year now (and which I loved).  Thus far, the last 2 hours spent with the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" have been amazing.  The screen on this device needs to be experienced first hand.  I've had some amazing LCD screens for my PCs and smartphones, but this thing is just remarkable.  It is hands down more beautiful than any other screen I've had my hands on.It's also a very "snappy" tablet. It just speeds along without a single slow down.  I had it downloading books, a hand full of graphic novels, The Hobbit Extended edition (also just purchased), and all the apps I needed...and it never slowed down.  No hiccups, no lag, no freezes...NO PROBLEMS...no sweat.I also don't see the "blue border" issue reported for the 7" HDX. I've tried all different brightness levels and white/sepia/black backgrounds (in bright and dark rooms) and I just don't see the blue "halo" around the edge of the device.  Maybe I got lucky...maybe it's not an issue with the 8.9" versions.The only downsides thus far are that I notice it leaves a much wider margin around the page when reading books than my old Kindle Fire HD did.  I've played with all the settings and it's just leaving bigger margins.  I prefer to have it almost edge to edge all around, but this doesn't let me get nearly as close as my old HD did.  Not a deal breaker...but odd.  Also, for some reason I've only seen 1 lock-screen image.  All I've seen is the film reel and there is no time on the lock-screen, which I would have sworn I saw in pre-release screenshots and is currently on my old 7" HD. Weird...I even tried to turn the power off several times...and it's always the same image. The old HD had a handful it went through...I thought the new versions would too, and I really wish the time was listed. Heck...while I'm making wishes, how about notifications for emails on the lock-screen!Overall, this device is spooky fast and beautiful.  I'll update this review as I use it more.  For now, I'm very happy with the purchase and can't wait to get into some movies!

Reviews.Title: Is it love, or is it just friendship?
Reviews.Author: Tzurunkle
Reviews.Content: I feel like I've been dating my new Kindle HDX 8.9. I'm looking for a long-term relationship-but I am swinging between infatuation for the many things that are terrific, to swinging back to mild disappointment with the things that bother me. A partial list of the very good:* The fabulous screen (FAB-U-LOUS!)* The ulta-lightness (it feel like the battery must be missing)* The great sound* Sharp sharp sharp text* The joy of reading Kindle books on it (no rim of purple or blue)* The smooth, quick operation--no stuttering!* The really surprisingly decent cameras front and back* The straight-forward and easy process to add (and view) my photographs and videos to this Kindle (Bravo! nothing hidden or difficult!)* The placement of the power and sound buttons are perfect for me* ALL the improvements in the operating system from the previous model listed in previous reviews are spot on. Great job Amazon!HOWEVER:* The fit and finish on mine is off. Where the rubberized section meets the shiny plastic on the back is not level, so there's just enough of a sharp ridge of the shiny plastic close to the top corners on both sides to make it uncomfortable to hold. It's where I normally would grasp it, and it's irritating like a bad seam in a shoe or a tag in a shirt that has to be cut out. It makes it feel cheap and I find myself wondering if I could just take a bit of sandpaper & fix it, but one shouldn't need to fix the finish on a tablet.* The app store (you've already read about it)* I thought I would not mind the ads on the opening screen, but I find that I dislike them more and more. They tend toward unattractive or childish ads for apps in which I have no interest. Again, this cheapens the experience for me. I really wish for the ability to personalize the screens with my own photographs to take advantage of that beautiful screen.Tablets are a very personal choice and what may not bother many may rub someone else the wrong way. It's obvious that this little much improved jewel will be love at first sight for some, but I'm beginning to feel that the Kindle HDX 8.9 and I will just be friends. It's more than a 3, but maybe just shy of a 4 for me.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 32gb
Reviews.Author: rjc
Reviews.Content: I have the original Kindle fire, it is a good device for what I used it for.  I wanted something that I could play video's ( Prime Member)  currently prime does not work on other andriods, Listen to music and take along notes for various projects.  I ended up going with the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 with 32 gb.  The applications that are avaialble are what I would use for any other device.  Keep in mind all devices have there limitations.  The limitation here is that you can only get apps from Amazon and not all applications available will work on your device.Pros:- The screen has crisp colors and the brightness can be adjusted to personal tast.-Start screen,  the start screen falls in line with the other tablets showing icons that you use the most along with the carosel.- Recently used apps are available while in an applications, by running fingure at the bottom of the page and dragging up to the top._ Built in speakers and volume are nice it has an setting to control the volume, that is behind the applications, so if you only want the valume you go so loud that can be set in the setting,- Battery life is decent, however standby time could be improved (a week at most).- Integration with the Amazon app store and Prime instant video was very seamless and easy to use._ With the latest version Doc go to the cloud so they can be retrieved by other devices, orginally had a seperate doc folder that was not accessable from the web.- The interface is surprisingly easy to navigate, although there are some inconsistencies (ie. the back button moving between apps) that could be improved with software updates.- CPU speed is really responsive, takes less then 30 seconds to boot from a cold start. tapping on once of the categories will bring up the screen within 10 seconds.-  Prime Movie Downloads.  While traveling I was able to download movies to watch on the plane,- MAYDAY!!! feature is good, they will help you troubleshoot your issues, must have WiFi acess for this to work.  If they cannot help you they will take your number and have a rep call you back.  They called me within 60 seconds.-Battery Life - I am able to get 8 - 12 hours of video usage out of my device.-Power on/off button.  Having the power off button on the back rather than on the bottom like the orginal fire is alot easier to use.- Easily transfer between device and cloud-Able to use Kindle to make telephone calls, that were crisp and clear.- Bluetooth - used a bluetooth keyboard that worked great. ( when not in use need to remember to turn bluetooth off)Cons:- No Google apps or Google features (only a problem if you’re mobile world is heavily influenced by Google; pictures, contacts, etc)- I had issues with switching between airplane mode and wifi, my WiFi would cut out after using airplane mode.- Not all web pages are compatabile with SILK the new web browser ( was trying to use Skillport).- Games show under apps and under Games-Cannot have an application open and display song information at the same time.-Had issues with the speakers, would not play sound after being in airplane mode.  Tech support was able to help with this.- External Storage, still lacks the ability to use SD cards of USB storage devices.

Reviews.Title: No Blue haze... very light, clear display, long run time.
Reviews.Author: Andrew Kim "Multix"
Reviews.Content: I originally purchased a Kindle HDX 7 with 16 GB.But, the unit had very bothersome blue haze around the edges which were about 3/16 to 1/4" wide.  I called Amazon, the technical department told me that blue haze was an enhancement and is not a defect.  So, I tried to live with the "enhancement" for about a week, and found that I could not overlook the "enhancement".  I tried different level of brightness, different color background, but found the blue haze to be intolerable.  I took, the advice of the Amazon technician who told me that there is no blue haze around the 8.9 inch HDX, and ordered the larger sibling with 64GB Wifi.Indeed, the new unit 8.9" has _NO_ blue haze.  The screen is clear and more crisper than 7" and I think better than the IPad.  The functionality of 8.9" unit is otherwise identical to the smaller 7" little brother( same cpu, ram, etc.)I opted for 64GB to be able to store about 30Gb of music on the tablet, along with some amount of videos for keeping kids entertained in road tripsI have LG G2 with 5.3" screen, 10 inch IPad and Android tablet,  12" laptop, 15" laptop, 17" laptop, and 24" desktop. Originally I thought 7" would be the nice intermediate size between the smart phone and the IPad.  I found that after using both 7" and 8.9",  8.9" is a more proper size that best fit my objectives.It is my belief, that there is no one device that can be designed to be best in all aspects of its function. So, depending on your objectives, IPAD, Nexus 7, Galaxy tab, etc. maybe a better fit.In order of importance for my objectives for the device:1) For reading books, which is THE primary objective for purchasing  Kindle 8.9 HDX, I believe that this unit is better than other competing devices.2) For viewing Video for entertainment purpose.  The screen is vivid and more than adequate for viewing any video.  Also, audio streaming to Bluetooth speaker.  I have already taken up about 28 GB of spaces for the MP3 files, and have currently 27GB left over for other purposes.  The sound quality of the built-in speaker cannot escape its physical limitations.  However, for medium background noise environment, the built-in speaker is adequate.3) The non-writing based work such as web surfing, and simple web interactions.  For simple viewing of web pages such as Wiki, it is very good choice due to its light weight and long running battery life.4) For Apps: For simple apps such as guitar tuner, FFT, Wolfram Alpha, specialized calculators, etc. the Kindle is a capable tool.  However, since I also have Android devices with me always, the most applications do not need to be in both Android phone and Kindle.  For application that can use larger "real estate" such as Wolfram Alpha in displaying graphs and visual, the 8.9 inch is a great advantage.The Play Store apps, though not directly accessible, most app can be side-loaded and used in Kindle.  If the Apps were the primary objectives, I would have chosen Google devices such as Nexus 7 ( cheaper though less size in "real estate").So, if your primary objective is to read books using Kindle (as it should be), it has no rival.  The screen is gorgeous.  Then, add to it, the battery life, the feather-light weight, the Prime membership, the ability to run apps, browse web in reasonably responsive manner, all give it a very high mark.My wish list for the Kindle future added enhancement or functionality:• Full support of Play Store.• mini-SD card slot• Streaming Video from NAS drives (wirelessly)• USB 3.0 connection.  This would enable video streaming from external USB HD.Above will definitely make Kindle a IPAD killer.  But, I don't expect these features to be incorporate any time soon.Overall, the Kindle meets my objectives, and is a well designed tablet.

Reviews.Title: Very slim and sleek design. very good product.
Reviews.Author: Rg "Rg"
Reviews.Content: Pros : Good design, very sleek, robostic performance. beats all the competative tablets on the market.cons:  found 2 issues so far.  1) I can feel the logic board heat behind the screen. 2) Wifi disconnects over a period of 24hrs..and unless you reboot, it is hard to get connect  it back.

Reviews.Title: Worth It
Reviews.Author: mom2
Reviews.Content: We gave this for our daughter. We love the Kindle Free Time for kids. We like the parental control very much. We don't have to worry how long she uses it and what are the activities she's doing.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Sandra L. Nuelken
Reviews.Content: Love it still trying to the figure out all the stuff it does..I love how Amazon seamlessly and flawlessly transferred all my stuff. Came fully charged and ready to go.

Reviews.Title: GREAT GIFT TO MYSELF
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS!  I am having so much fun with my new Kindle Fire.  Reading the books , playing the games , taking pictures and listening to music.

Reviews.Title: Love my new HDX 8.9. It's my 3rd Kindle and they keep getting better.
Reviews.Author: Roxanne Davis
Reviews.Content: So far, I love this 8.9 HDX. Have had no problems except for the "slide device up" notice for using the rear facing camera. This must be programmed in and needs to be GONE. Other 3rd party manufacturers of covers think that the hole in the back for the camera and flash is enough ... it is not. It's a pain to remove this from the case every time you need to take a photo. The case made by Amazon for the HDX works fine but it's not the case for everyone so PLEASE fix this Amazon. Love your new Kindle!!!

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet for a great price!
Reviews.Author: hispanoloco
Reviews.Content: I decided to take the opportunity of Amazon's free trial any of their Kindles.  I decided to try out the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9''.  I currently use the iPad Air and been using iPad 2 for a year and a half.  I really enjoyed playing with this Kindle Fire.  Interface needed some getting used to, but one I figured it out, it was very user friendly. It was strange not having a home button.  Sometimes, when playing games, I would accidentally bring up the 'home' bar, but face that with iOS 7 also.  I love the cloud feature and the integration of all of my Amazon services.Amazon gave 500 coins, which was about $5.00 to try some apps.  I purchased a game and a move rental.  Screen was clear and sharp for all videos, including the rental and videos on Amazon Prime.  But the games seem to lose resolution.  I am going to assume its due the games haven't been formatted for new higher resolution screen.Design was sharp looking and Kindle is lighter than the iPad Air, but the plastic makes it feel less expensive and not as sturdy as I feel with the iPad Air.  I did like the separation of the Left and Right speakers, gave it a more stereo feel to it.Price was great, cheaper than iPad Air, this comes with my biggest issue.  All my apps, games, music, and movies are from iTunes.  Even though I really enjoyed the Kindle, it will require me to make another couple of thousand of dollars investment to switch from iTunes to Amazon.  Which I cannot do.  But I would recommend this Kindle to everyone who is looking for their first tablet.

Reviews.Title: Fastest, best screen out there period.
Reviews.Author: E. Swope
Reviews.Content: I have been carrying a tablet for 7 years, starting with the Nokia 770 Internet Tablet PC.  For most of the years since I have had an Archos because up to this point nothing else beat it for speed, resolution or versatility (compatibility with the broadest array of file types).  My Archos 101 G9 Turbo ICS 8GB 10-Inch Tablet 2 generations back still beats the specs of most existing tablets.  I read a lot of reviews before I buy and am usually up on not only what is out, but what has not yet been released.  I finally bought a kindle this year because it is the first tablet that bests the Archos on speed, resolution and value.  I went to best buy to look at it and had a hard time getting near it. The kids were lined up, could not put it down.  It really is as fast as a console.  Most people honestly do not need this much speed lol.  Where it will shine for the average person is in superior video, high pixel count, clarity of color.  It was the improved color rendering which was most noticeable to me.  I am amazed at reviews complaining about either speed or resolution. Nothing else out now touches it.  The form factor and build quality are really nice.  This is a wonderful little device which really is beyond the needs of most people.  There is little to legitimately complain about.  Most of the valid criticism I have seen has to do with access to the play store.  For me it is not an issue. I have been able to find all the aps I want or need on Amazon, but I do understand that some people want specific things for business which may or may not be available.  If that is a potential issue for you check Amazon's ap store.But, honestly, ignore reviews complaining about speed or screen resolution.  Go to any tech site and you will see that this tablet is the highest on both counts.I really didn't *need* a new tablet. I have 4 already :O but was grabbed by the form factor and build, had to check out the screen.  It really is an instant on tablet with just gorgeous color rendition and amazing clarity.  If you are buying it for video or internet use you should be very impressed.One word of warning, keep it away from your kids or you may never see it again ;)

Reviews.Title: Excellent tablet.
Reviews.Author: Bill Dowis
Reviews.Content: Love this.  It has plenty of storage space for my music cd's and videos and still a ton of room to spare.I am so happy they put a camera on the other side.

Reviews.Title: Wow, Looks great and its quick
Reviews.Author: Stephen Stagray
Reviews.Content: Wow, Looks great and its quick.  Connecting to my network was fast and easy.  The Silk browser is ok still working on loading Chrome.

Reviews.Title: 5 star Product! Excellent!
Reviews.Author: Hawks2u
Reviews.Content: This is by far the very best tablet in the market! Excellent! Beautiful graphics, crystal clear picture, smooth, a delightful product!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding!
Reviews.Author: G. Benfield "Flyboy"
Reviews.Content: The best device of this type: phenomenal screen clarity, untra-fast wi-fi connection, exceptional versatility. The HDX does it all and does it all extremely well.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy With This Purchase
Reviews.Author: Steph B
Reviews.Content: I debated on a tablet and decided to go with the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9", Wi-Fi, 64 GB.  I also got the Origami case and the blue tooth keyboard.  It showed up when promised and was ready to go with a full battery when I opened it.  It was very simple to start and I was loading apps right away.  I don't plan on using this tablet for too much work, but more for reading, social media, movies, music and games, so I can't speak much on that aspect.  The rear and front facing cameras were a plus for me.  The keyboard was very simple to add and I am typing this review with it.  My husband, who does not enjoy technology, was left alone with this tablet and he had game apps downloaded and playing in no time.  We've only had it for a couple days, but so far would recomend it to anyone that is looking for a tablet to enjoy for around the house use.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hdx 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Mary "mrhc45"
Reviews.Content: I have had mine for 1 week and I love it. I find my battery life  isn't as long as they say though. I use to leave my original kindle fire in  Sleep mode and it didn't wear down like this one does, so I shut this one down when I won't be using it for a few hours. It takes good pictures.  Clear sharp pictures.Is there a way to get rid of the special offers? Another person wrote it was what is draining the battery.But I do love my kindle fire. Was a birthday present to myself.

Reviews.Title: Finally ... an easy to use digital device!
Reviews.Author: Craig A.
Reviews.Content: The MAYDAY feature has made using the 8.9 HDX easy for this "Digital Idiot".  The agents have so much patience and can speak to me in a language I can understand.  It makes owning and using it a real pleasure.  It's much easier than my iphone that I've had for 3 years and, the camera and video feature takes much better pictures than my digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Beats IPad by a mile! Amazon you have another hit on your hands with this new Kindle fire HDX 8.9"
Reviews.Author: D. Williams "Coyote Dave"
Reviews.Content: This is the best Kindle yet! I love my 7" kindle fire HD and use it all the time. However this Kindle fire HDX 8.9" is light and fast! And with the May day feature you can't go wrong! I just used it to get help setting up Skype. The personalized help and quick response I'm going to be spoiled! IPad look out! Way to go Amazon!

Reviews.Title: BEAUTIFUL
Reviews.Author: MTCUBED66
Reviews.Content: Just as good as my Kindle Fire HDX 7 inch. Perfect size for certain things that were  a little small on the 7 inch. Lightweight, excellent product. I would recommend you get the one with Special Offers. I have bought more than one thing because of seeing it on the special offers screen. They come up as screensavers sometimes on the unlock screen, or you can go to the top bar and scroll all the way over to view all special offers. The sound is very good quality, in fact it is better than my laptop sound. Good battery life, I can play apps all day on it. I would highly recommend this tablet. The Kindle also has great accessories available.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet with a ton of new features
Reviews.Author: James R Davis
Reviews.Content: There are a ton of different kinds of tablets and e-readers out there today and it's hard to know which one to buy. Some of them can have features you don't understand and sometimes they just all seem to be the same thing at different prices, so you don't know which one to pick. As someone who has had personal experience with several different tablets (and a couple e-readers), I would recommend this one. It comes with so many features and options that it may seem overwhelming at first, but it's definitely worth sifting through it all.The Kindle Fire HDX is designed with the user in mind and is built to help you do everything you would want to on a tablet. The Kindle has always had a pretty good display, but this one truly takes it to the next level. The images and colors pop out at you just as well as any good computer, and possibly better than some. They also gave us improved brightness settings and reduced the glare so you can use the tablet in bright lights or outside without blinding yourself or having to deal with those annoying bright spots.The performance is better than any Kindle before. In layman's terms, it works faster and better than ever before. Even so, it's very thin for easy holding and storage, but very durable, so it takes more to break it. It claims to have a 12 hour battery life, or 18 if you're just reading, but in my experience it can often stretch to around 20, depending on what you're doing.The two cameras, one on the front and one on the back, are excellent. The front camera offers a pretty clear picture. It's perfect for taking selfies or things like video calls with your friends or your boss. The read end camera takes amazing quality pictures and comes with a flash option so you can even use the camera in dark environment. The rear end camera also comes with several features and options which improve picture taking.The Kindle Fire HDX also has a new feature which they call the MayDay button.
