It's basically a help button that you can push at any time. It connects you to a live representative who can help you with any problem you're having with the Kindle. They're available at any time, for free. I've used the service a couple of times when I was confused about how to do something and they were great. They helped me fix my issue quickly and they were super polite. This feature may seem unnecessary but you won't think that when you end up needing it. You'll be glad that it's there and that you can use it for free!It comes with Prime Instant Video downloads. You have to already be an Amazon Prime member to use it, but once you are, this feature means that you can download any video from Amazon Prime to your tablet. Then you can watch it wherever you are, even if you don't have an internet connection. I use this to watch movies on long flights. It keeps me entertained and even helps me a bit with the sick feeling I usually get on planes.The tablet comes with a lot of new apps that can help you do the stuff that's important to you, like accessing your email and calender, plus a lot of other new apps to help your productivity. Of course, you can still install all the other apps that you might want to, just like with any other tablet.They've also added a new and improved operating system for this version, which they call Mojito. It starts with an Android base, but Amazon has added on a lot of their own stuff to make it more personal and easier to use for their customers. Mojito is completely customer oriented, so you're sure to love how convenient it is and what it can do for you.This tablet comes with a huge amount of other features that I can't possibly discuss here as thoroughly as they deserve to be. Beyond that, it has some options that are personalize at the time of purchase. They give you three options for the amount of storage you want - 16 GB, 32 GB, or 64 GB. I personally am using the 64 GB version, but if you're usually the tablet casually or just for reading, you can probably get away with a smaller amount of storage.They let you choose whether or not you want to see advertisements on your table (what they call special offers), and it's not that much more, so I would recommend getting the ad free version, but it's not that big of a deal if you don't want to pay extra for it.They also give you options about your internet connection. You can choose to get just Wi-fi, or you can get 4G LTE from either Verizon or AT&T.; I go through AT&T; and it's always worked perfectly for me. Pages load great and load time is nearly non-existent.You can also buy a 2 year warranty which includes accident protection. This isn't necessary, but I would recommend it, just in case something happens. Paying a little more to get the warranty is a lot cheaper than if the tablet breaks for whatever reason and you don't have any way to replace it. After all, buying a replacement tablet will cost far more than what you would pay for the warranty. It just makes sense when you do the math. You might also want to consider buying a case for it. I have one, and it helps me to keep it safe, plus it looks pretty cool.Overall, I would definitely recommend the Kindle Fire HDX, whether you're looking for a new tablet or just a simple e-reader. It has the features to be great for everybody. For more great electronics, check out http://www.amazon.com/b?_encoding=UTF8&site-redirect;=&node;=13900871&tag;=tabbooingcom-20&linkCode;=ur2&camp;=1789&creative;=9325

Reviews.Title: Not Bad, but I Miss Google
Reviews.Author: NuJoi "Create with me"
Reviews.Content: I like my new Kindle Fire HDX 8.9, but I'm not not in love with it. I've used the iPad, iPad mini and Blackberry Playbook, so I had a pretty good idea of what I wanted in a tablet. In the end, I narrowed it down to the Kindle Fire and iPad because I'm a member of Prime and I wanted to view Amazon streaming video on on a mobile device. Also, my favorite apps are not available for Android devices. I chose the Kindle Fire because of price and I know I will still one day get an iPad. So, the Fire is my iPad Mini. In terms of functionality, and I'll discuss this more below, the Fire is more reader and less tablet.With all that said, here's what I do love about the device -- it's a great value. The size is perfect for reading and I do love to hold it portrait style and read it like a book. If I feel really daring, I do so without the origami case so that I can appreciate how lightweight it is. The Amazon leather origami case is a really cool idea, but not great protection. Took me a day or so to get used to it. I do wish is was lighter and I wish I could get it in pink.I like the organization of my stuff -- carousel, home page/favorites and collections. I do have suggestions for improvements:1. I wish you could add web pages to the carousel2.  I wish the tablet would learn that just because I used something recently, I don't want it in the carousel.3.  I wish the collections could be for more than apps. For example, for my morning devotion time, I would love a collection that contained my gospel playlist, Bible reading apps and certain Kindle books.4.  There's no way to organize picturesMayday is so sweet. Although, I've realized that the help is really about technical issues, not bigger questions like why can't the device run Google apps. Still, this is an awesome feature if you a gifting the Fire to someone who is not tech savvy.As expected, the Amazon apps work great. I would like more visual notification to indicate which movies and TV shows that can be downloaded to the device. It should be just as easy to spot as the Prime indicator.The biggest disappointment with the Fire is no Google apps (as of January 1, 2014). This is why I consider the Fire more of a reader and less of a tablet. Without Google apps like Drive, Google Maps; YouTube and the full cadre of Android apps (like Instagram), this device fails to be a really serious workhorse. For those who use Chrome, you never realize how much you depend on it until it's gone. Don't be confused by the Google apps you see in the Amazon Appstore. These are workarounds developed by others; there are no Google apps, developed by Google, in the Appstore. You can sideload some Anddroid apps onto the Kindle (and I have done so for Instagram and PocketBible), but my point is that I shouldn't have to.If Google and Apple can find common ground, I simply don't understand why Amazon has to be so territorial with the Kindle. I'm wondering if this is the same marketing mistake Blackberry made with the Playbook; the marketplace has pretty much decided that we need two mobile operating systems, iOS and Android. I'm sure Amazon will say that developers have the option of putting versions of their apps in the Amazon App Store, but the fact that many haven't says something.Being forced to live without Google apps has forced me to discover a new favorite app -- Feedly, for blog reading. I've downloaded it to my Android and Apple devices.My next biggest issue with the Fire is the Special Offers. (I know I have the option of removing them for $15.) I'm complaining not because they are there, but because they are so 'untargeted' to me. Amazon has more than a decade of my purchasing history, wish lists, web data and tons of my reviews. Serve me ads for stuff you'd think I'd buy. I was expecting Special Offers to be so much better -- as good as recommendations on my Amazon.com homepage. The Special Offers are generally crappy because I have no interest in the products.Update 2/17/14: I have found a bug in the music playlists. I create my playlists on the cloud using my Kindle. I then dowload them to the device. All of the songs are already saved to the device before I download the playlist. However, songs will be missing from the downloaded playlist. The cloud version has 117 songs, the on-device version has three. Mayday and customer support gave me a solution. So, I uninstalled all music from the device and downloaded it all again from the cloud. I then downloaded the cloud playlists and the problem was solved -- for a few hours. Later, when I updated and created new cloud playlists; uninstalled the device playlists; and downloaded the cloud playlists again, songs were missing.Update 3/15,14: After weeks of back and forth, the issue above was resolved with a replacement Kindle. My cloud playlists loaded onto the device without a hitch. I haven't revised the cloud versions and tried to reload onto the device yet; no new songs have caught my ear. I have to say the getting the issue resolved left me very frustrated. Amazon's usually stellar customer service just didn't bring its A-game. I was so relieved when the rep I spoke with a week ago agreed to ship me another device. It took way too long to get to that solution.I find the speed to be slower than my iPhone and Galaxy phone.  I used all three while playing my favorite mobile game via Wi-Fi. When response time matters, I go for the iPhone instead of the Fire.My Fire has a problem connecting to free Wi-Fi. I haven't hit the Mayday button yet to figure out if it's something I'm doing wrong. The device will connect, but it takes a long while for it to tell you that you need to go to the provider's web page to agree to the terms and conditions. Opening the Silk browser yourself to get to the permissions page doesn't always work.I ordered the 16GB version based on other reviewers' comments regarding Prime movie and TV downloads. If I had it to do over again, I would have given more thought to the 32 GB because I have the Wi-Fi version. If I had gotten Wi-Fi+4G, 16 GB would have been just fine because I would have always had the connectivity to stream what I wanted to watch.All in all, the Fire isn't a bad purchase. I think how much you like it depends on what you're used to from other tablets and even your smartphone. It's a good value, but Amazon needs to rethink the relationship with Google. My user experience isn't as rich as it could be without more Android apps.

Reviews.Title: Definitely A Keeper!
Reviews.Author: Hal in Howell
Reviews.Content: I received my Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 last Thursday and I am very pleased.  It is SO fast compared to the Kindle Fire HD and lighter, too.  The HDX has a much more responsive touch screen and unmatched screen resolution.  WiFi set up was effortless. I was able to easily set up my various email accounts and download all the apps I used on the old KFHD including Netflix for video streaming (I also have Amazon Prime).  I side-loaded the Dolphin browser in order to view Flash videos (just like on my old HD).  Battery endurance seems very good and have run the HDX several hours at a time (I've not run the battery flat yet and recharge every morning).My only criticism of the HDX is the lack of the HDMI plug (I know, wireless is the future and all that, but I did like having it for travel where wireless video connection is just not available).  I'm holding on to my HD solely for the HDMI functionality.  This complaint is certainly not a deal killer.I've barely used the rear-facing camera (took just one photo to see if it worked and it does and the photo looked very good and I will be using it in the future). The rear-facing camera is a great addition and remedies my major complaint about the KFHD.The only real problem I've encountered with the HDX is that I'm unable to delete photos I downloaded from the Cloud (see updates below).  Enter the Mayday button.  I've got to say that Amazon's customer service is second to none (I guess it's part of their on-going plan for World Domination).  I pressed the Mayday button and I had a live CS person on-line within 15 seconds.  She attempted to fix the photo deletion problem without success.  However, she escalated the issue to a tech support person who, after going through several diagnostic procedures, wrote up a trouble ticket to pass on to the developers; all this taking place on-line (the problem is apparently unique).  A callback is scheduled for later this week.  The whole point of this story is to show how responsive Amazon is to customer problems.  BTW, the photo deletion issue in no way affects the functionality of my Kindle.I read just about all the 1-star reviews before purchasing and found few complaints that were credible (it seems that most of the negative reviews were by iPad fanboys or by those who just didn't know what they were talking about.  I invite you to read those reviews and see for yourself; they are quite entertaining in a perverse sort of way). The Kindle Fire HDX that I own is not the same HDX the 1-star reviewers were talking about.At the end of the day, the KFHDX is a superb device.  It is definitely not just an e-book reader.  I'm still discovering all that it can do.  I highly recommend it.I will update this review with the results of the Kindle problem mentioned above.*********Update January 3, 2014**********Received a callback from Amazon (on-time as promised) regarding the photo deletion problem.  The developers are stumped, but are still working on it.  There is supposed to be a new software update release in the next couple of weeks that may resolve the issue.  If that fails, we may try a factory reset (not my favorite solution as I'll have to reenter all my email settings, etc.).  If the reset fails Amazon will just send me a new device and I'll just start over.  I'm pleased with Amazon's efforts, though disappointed it may require a reset or de-registration or replacement of the Kindle.  At least the problem doesn't affect the Kindle's functionality in any way.  High marks to Amazon CS.  I still love the Kindle.  Further updates will be forthcoming.*********Update January 11, 2014*********I solved the photo deletion issue!  The problem was I was unable to delete photos.  The Kindle kept asking if I wanted to delete the photos from the Cloud (there were no photos on the Cloud).  I solved the problem by asking the Kindle to download the undeleteable (that's not a word, is it) photos from the Cloud even though there were no photos on the Cloud).  I could then delete them.  Apparently the Kindle got locked in some sort of loop and attempting to download non-existent photos broke the loop.  It took me awhile to figure it out, but it worked.  I'll have to let Kindle CS know about this.

Reviews.Title: Wow, this is a very nice tablet!
Reviews.Author: KG62
Reviews.Content: This was my Christmas present, I love it! The colors and the picture quality are sharp and crystal clear! I have never owned a tablet before so I don't have anything to compare it to.After figuring out where everything is,(not very hard at all) I have been having a lot of fun messing around playing with apps and games that were horrible and hard to see on my phone but oh-so-much-fun to play on this tablet! Even games I had downloaded for my little granddaughter are fun! :DUsing the cloud app I was able to send some of the pictures from my phone to the fire and the pictures look great! I tried out the camera as well and the picture quality was sharp and clear, I just had a harder time taking pictures using this, especially if I tried to zoom in on something. I'm sure once I use this more it will get easier. There are  picture editing functions built in too.I have tried streaming Amazon movies and YouTube videos. It  was easy, they played smoothly, and were excellent quality. The volume level and speakers actually sound better than my laptop. I think I am really liking this little machine! :)My books were easy to see in their collections, but I do like reading on my PaperWhite 2 better. I will use this more for cookbooks and magazines that have color pictures and save the rest of the book reading for my PaperWhite.I'm sure I will find even more things to love about my Kindle Fire as I discover the rest of the things it can do.

Reviews.Title: Long time Kindle Owner
Reviews.Author: Irene M. Dudley
Reviews.Content: I have had the Kindle DX (Bought a couple of times over thanks to a theft and a dropped Kindle) I decided I wanted to get the Kindle Fire for some of the magazines I am subscribed to as well as the NY Times. I have had a few stops and starts trying to figure out how to use a full touch screen electronic component. Also navigating the store and my library. Not all my kindle games are compatable with the fire. My review is less from a tech head perspective and more of just a user.I got it and it was automatically registered to my account since I bought it through Amazon. I was thrilled to see I was given some free tokens for audio books and games which I used. (I had a driving trip coming up the following week) The audio book played well through the aux outlet to the car stereo. I could see my pre-exisiting library on the cloud and select the items to download to my fire device. I got a little stuck 2 weeks into ownership trying to access netflix. It doesn't run on the silk browser. So I tried to download firefox which isn't available for Kindle although the app is in the Amazon store. This  ended up with a mayday call by accident (I was just trying to email customer service) and the rep was on video chat in less than a minute and helped me find the netflix app as well as answer another question about my Amazon watchlist navigation. That mayday app is worth the whole cost of the Kindle in my opinion. I have watched a number of videos, the streaming is great, the download aspect worked well. I could hear well, I didn't even feel the need to use headphones. I have shopped through the audio books, bookstore and videos. It has worked well, no complaints.A word of advice. I wavered between getting the 4G Verizon option or just wifi. At home I have wireless for my internet so it would be no issue for the Kindle. But I do travel occaisonally so I was concerned about that. Then I did the math If I bought 4G it is roughly an additional 80.00 on the cost and then I have to add it to my cell phone plan which runs an additional 20-25.00 a month. The I remembered virtually all 3G 4G smartphones have the hotspot capability. This includes mine and was something  I just discovered this year. So I skipped getting 4G. In the 3 weeks I have been out and about I have had to activate the hotspot option on my phone to allow my kindle to hook up and download a paper. It has worked great. It certainly beats the extra cost of getting 4G capable and the monthly plan addition. So think abo

Reviews.Title: Great First Impression
Reviews.Author: Moonlight Graham "Ben"
Reviews.Content: Upon first inspection, I was thoroughly impressed with the look and design of the Kindle Fire HDX. Having owned both the original Kindle Fire and a Kindle Fire HD, I was unsure about the need to upgrade. I couldn't help myself, though. The ability to download Prime movies was exactly what I was waiting for, since I take the train downtown every day. I'm actually impressed with the availability of downloads. I've already downloaded a bunch of episodes of The Shield, Friday Night Lights, and Sherlock. The quantity of available Prime videos for download may seem like it's not enough, but I can only assume Amazon will be vastly expanding this as time goes on.The picture quality was the first thing I noticed. This thing is razor sharp. The video plays very, very well on it, and the sound is good as well. I typically only use my headphones. My only gripe is that changing the volume is a two-step process on the screen now. I'm not sure why they made that harder - you have to tape the screen, then tap the volume icon, then adjust the volume. Previously, the volume slider was available with a simple tap on the screen. I hope they change that with an upgrade. The volume +/- is also on the back of the HDX, which makes it harder to adjust while using a case.This thing is almost weightless. The oragami case more than doubles the weight of it. It is truly impressive how light they have made this while keeping the price down.There is, however, one bad thing, that I'm hoping is just a glitch. My HDX froze after connecting to a new wireless network. It was unable to turn back on. I contacted Amazon's technical support, which was awesome. They're shippng me a replacement, which will be here in two days. The customer service was outstanding, and while this was an unfortunate issue, I wouldn't dock the HDX a star for it (yet). If it happens more often or to other people, it would definitely be a detriment to the reputation of the product. I'm guessing it was an isolated incident, though. I've never had a problem with my other Amazon devices, so I have confidence the replacement HDX will do just fine. I will update the review if anything happens with that one.Overall, this thing is amazing. I do think it's worth the upgrade, especially if you have an original Kindle Fire. The video quality is great, and the ability to download Prime videos is amazing and makes the device worth it on its own if you commute on a train. I'm looking forward to using this thing every day for a long time.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" Tablet
Reviews.Author: SAB
Reviews.Content: I never thought I would be a tablet person. I got my Kindle Fire and it has become my go to entertainment device. I love reading books on it and love the fact that Kindle book prices are lower than print! I am amazed at the quality of the picture with movies and TV shows. I use it daily and find it easy to use and add apps and books. I am a convert!

Reviews.Title: I like it when indoors
Reviews.Author: Kathryn L. Newton "klofcolo"
Reviews.Content: I really like it indoors, but I hate it outdoors.  I like to go outside with my dog and sit on the patio and it is almost impossible to see anything on the screen outside.  I like to photograph Birds and Wildlife and outside I can't see what I have - I have just a Kindle Touch reader so I use that outside and the Kindle Fire inside.  I would not order another one!

Reviews.Title: absolutely love it!!
Reviews.Author: Tia
Reviews.Content: I received my new kindle this week, and test-drove it on a 6 hour flight. At this time, I have only positive things to say about it, and I will highlight some points for those who are thinking about making the purchase- I know they are expensive.I purchased the 64 gb version because I have an external hard drive of movies that I will rotate on my kindle. At the beginning, I put 8 2-hour movies on it, and still had space. So if you don't plan to add external media, you will be fine with  smaller data size.The internet works fast. All of my amazon media content is stored in my cloud. Any games that you purchased for a previous kindle will not transfer, so be advised of that. The picture quality is awesome, the graphics jump out at you, I couldn't be more pleased.The battery lasts forever. I used the kindle constantly throughout my flight, switching between movies and games, and still had plenty of juice. The machine is very easy to operate, and was cheaper than the iPad.I also like the book display. This kindle has a built-in backlight and magazines display nicely- as do comic books. I highly recommend this kindle.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware of Many Issues
Reviews.Author: Sharon
Reviews.Content: I own one of the older Kindle Fires and was excited to receive this as a gift from my husband.  It worked OK in the beginning but within a few months it began shutting itself down. It would not come back on unless you did the hard reset, which is holding the power button down for 30 seconds.  This issue continued along with the fact that it would drop your internet connection and it would not update your email unless you shut it completely off.  After a few months of this my husband convinced me to contact Amazon.  The tech I talked to told me that the covers that Amazon sold could be part of the problem and I removed it.  He also tried to get me to reset to factory defaults and I asked to wait and let me give the coverless Kindle a try.It was better but still not right.  Finally I had enough when it shut down on me over 12 times in a row.  Each time staying on less than 45 seconds and freezing.  I did a reset to factory defaults in one of my 45 second windows.  When I tried to set it up again, it froze up.  Needless to say, I once again contacted Amazon and once again, I had to speak with someone that I could not understand.  He tried to get me to reset again and would not listen when I told him it wouldn't stay on long enough for me to do anything.  I got frustrated and hung up on him.My next step was live chat.  I chatted with someone and explained my problem  He must have clocked out for the day because suddenly I was chatting with someone else and he wanted to know what the problem was again.  He was not helpful and if anything I found him to be defensive.  My only option he said was to return it and he had no idea about the covers being a problem.I asked if I was going to get another new one or a refurbished one and he couldn't tell me.  Although he did agree to replace my cover.  He is sending the cover with one day shipping and my Kindle with two day shipping.  What sense does that make?The only positive thing I can about it is the screen is nice when it does decide to work. If I had it to do over I would have asked for the iPad instead.  Live and Learn.  Don't waste your money.UPDATE 05/20/15:I wanted to let everyone know that I received my refurbished Kindle Fire HDX yesterday.  It was supposed to be here on Friday but even though I verified the correct address with the customer service rep twice, it was sent to another address that is not the main address on my account. I was able to contact another customer service rep and all they could say was that he made a mistake and then they had the Kindle re-routed to my home.  I am not happy that I received a used Kindle and the first customer service rep I spoke with told me he would make a note in my file that since mine wasn't used that often he would request a new one for me.  As I stated before the last rep I spoke with wasn't very nice and he couldn't tell me what they would send. I will update if this one gives me any problems.

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC!!! Almost perfect!
Reviews.Author: James Duckett
Reviews.Content: I'm a big movie buff, so I wanted 64GB so I'd never have to worry about not having enough video to keep me entertained when I'm away from WiFi for a long time. Also, it's hard to tell what I'll be in the mood for, so I'll often load it up with movies that I might want to catch later. Some have sit there for months, and I still haven't been in the mood for them, but some day I will be and having 64GB certainly helps with that. I don't have to live in fear that I'll get in the mood for a show I don't have.The screen is beautiful. This is my go-to 10" tablet, mostly used for watching media and for playing a few games. I have a Kindle Paperwhite and I do all of my reading from that, so I don't use this for reading except in some rare situations. I love how this ties into my Audible account, so I always have my Audible books with me as well (again, thank you 64GB).Videos work awesome on this. The resolution is nice and crisp. The speakers are also awesome, though I do wish some tablet maker would have them facing the listener instead of going out the back. I feel like I'm missing a lot of sound with it shooting out its rear end. Sometimes I'll cup the speakers in a way that the sound is redirected back to me, but if I'm listening tot his device, I always do it from the back. Those speakers are awesome, Amazon, please, please, PLEASE figure out a way to move them up front.It says you should get 12 hours of battery life watching video. I've never experienced this. When it was new, maybe 7 hours of battery life. After a few months of using and charging, I can probably burn through a battery in 5 hours watching Hulu or streaming other media. I've seen worse (like Microsoft's Surface tablet and my Dell XPS tablet/laptop), but I expected better from Amazon, especially when it claims 12 hours while watching video and 18 hours while just reading. I'm not seeing it. Apple does tend to live up to their claims on battery life, in my opinion.Otherwise, I've got no regrets dropping $500 on this. I'm usually by a charging source, and since this uses standard USB and not some proprietary connector (*cough* *cough* APPLE *cough*), finding a charging source is easy. It doesn't seem to take long to fully charge this either... maybe an hour or so with a 2.1amp charger. $500 would get you the entry-level Apple iPad, which is only 16GB, which I can fill easily. I have a large-capacity iPad Mini, which is decent for watching shows on, but it seems to struggle with some video and games now and then. I find myself using my iPad Mini less and less and my HDX more and more.If I had to choose again, I'd pick up this HDX over the iPad in a heartbeat. When compared to some Android tablets, I'd have to do a lot more debating, but in that debate Apple would always take third place and, even then, would have to content with the Microsoft Surface.

Reviews.Title: piece of crap
Reviews.Author: Peter S Park
Reviews.Content: I just spoke with kindle support and they just notified me that my WiFi dropping issue is a known issue and that they are working on a fix.  This is extremely disappointing that amazon would release a product with this bad of a bug and no solutions to work around the problems.  Amazon will have to work hard to regain this customer's trust.Sincerely a long time prime member

Reviews.Title: My new baby!
Reviews.Author: Jenxie
Reviews.Content: I bought this over a week ago and am loving it. Very user friendly and the screen resolution is great. I bought this because I am about to start chemotherapy and radiation in a few weeks and I wanted something to search the internet and stream movies and tv during my treatments. (I don't do ebooks, real books for life!) The only thing that it's lacking is good apps but that's not surprising as I have an Android phone and already knew this. With that said, I'm still very happy I sprung for the 8.9 instead of the 7.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Clark Fleming
Reviews.Content: I had been putting off getting a Fire because I already have an iPad and also have a Kindle Paperwhite (very pleased with the paperwhite - especially for reading in a dark room).  Finally, after a friend's positive experience with a Kindle Fire, I decided to get one.  I truly enjoy this little tablet.  I use it to read, check email, and occasionally go to a web page for something.  Bar none, it's the easiest tablet on which to set up email accounts - all kinds:  POP, iMAP, gmail, Exchange Network.  Usually to get all my email accounts working I have to enter manually several items.  Not so with the Fire; it found it all automatically.  Silk (browser) is fast enough, but not as speedy as Safari.  I find myself carrying the Fire more and more.  The screen is out of sight, very high resolution and it shines through when watching any video.  If it is also reliable (I'll see), then Amazon has a real winner.

Reviews.Title: What a disappointment!!!
Reviews.Author: PBoyles "PBoyles"
Reviews.Content: I love, love, love my original Kindle and used it all the time.  The new Kindle Fire awful; it shuts down all the time or it freezes up.  Not just occasionally but every few minutes and all the time no matter what I'm doing.  Even just reading a book the think restarts every couple of pages and does save my location.  Does everyone have this same experience or is mine the only one???

Reviews.Title: Not multi functional...great as a reader, not so much for web browsing!
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: Our household has been very satisfied users of the Kindle products for a number of years, primarily as a reader (original edition and a Fire, purchased in 2012). I purchased the HDX as a gift for my husband who wanted to use it as a browser as well as a reader. Unfortunately, using it as a browser is often a frustrating experience in that it is slow and can be counted on to crash at least once with every session.After two returns, and being shipped two replacements resulting in the same issue, we've given up and reconciled to the fact that we'll live with it!Note: though an inconvenience, our experience with customer service was extremely cordial and professional!

Reviews.Title: mixed feelinga
Reviews.Author: LL
Reviews.Content: I loved the resolution, the lightness and the battery life, but it's not really a work thing. for the price, I can't justify it for my needs, tho.  Oh, the screen seems to flicker a lot and I couldn't figure out how o stop it. there seems to be connectivity issues with older routers. was up and down a lot at home but not at the office. why give 3 stars then (I returned it)? because i think for someone using it for Prime or games or Facebook would be happier with it and there's probably a way to control the screen flickering but I didn't have the patience to figure it out. Also, someones else's state of the art wireless system probably won't have connection issues. can't helped but be impressed with the design. I don't think throwing in a stand/cover for the price would kill Amazon, tho. Let's not start nickle and diming us on everything, folks...

Reviews.Title: One happy girl!
Reviews.Author: MiaGirl
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle 8.9 HDX, I upgraded from the 7" Fire HD, because I wanted a larger screen, faster processor and a rear facing camera and this one has it all. I was hoping to get a little more battery power from the HDX, but I haven't noticed much of an improvement from the 7" fire. I still have to charge it every other day depending on what I do with it, but I do use my kindle everyday!  The HDX is very user friendly and the colors are beautiful. I've taken several pictures and videos and I'm definitely satisfied with the quality. I can really tell the difference with the quicker processor, my emails load up much faster as well as web pages when I'm browsing.  I'm traveling to Europe soon and I needed access to my email and the internet, rather than carrying my laptop with me, my Kindle will be really convenient, I'll have my books, music and documents in this 8.9" powerhouse. As far as my 7" fire, it is still going strong, but now I let my grandkids use it and so far its holding up to the challenge.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Jan Blackwell
Reviews.Content: I enjoy the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 and use it a lot. I'm not into a lot of the stuff it is capable of doing, mostly reading, playing games and checking email. My disappointments with it are: 1. Big issue, I really wanted the availability of having the camera. Afterspending so much on this opted for inexpensive case. Case is designed to be used with the camera but software issue blocks the camera view. Thought I could just take it out of the case and use it but view is still blocked by message to move it up in case. Apparently only solution is to buy their expensive case. Really Amazon?? 2. Because of glare it is difficult to impossible to use if you are outside on sunny day. 3. My $30. e-cigarette charger has light  that lets me know if it is charging or done charging. After all the charging issues with first generation Kindle Fire I don't understand why they would have gotten rid of the charging light. Not good design decision to me. In view of these issues the four star rating seems too high but I do like it too much to use only three stars because I do consider it above average.

Reviews.Title: Didn't think...
Reviews.Author: Linda Hall "A truck driver"
Reviews.Content: I didn't think this would be any better than my old (well not really old only a little over a year) Kindle Fire. But, the 1.9" makes a big difference. Plus the internet and the videos and games download much faster.I love being able to fling things onto my TV (I also have the Fire TV which is excellent). I can even fling my books onto the TV (though I was told by a rep that you can't). Since I make bread and like to try new recipes this is excellent. I can put the recipe on my TV and see it from the kitchen (set your Kindle to stay on for an hr or so).It also makes some of the games  more fun. Mostly the hidden object games, the action games can't be used on TV unless it's strictly for others to watch you play. But, the hidden objects are easier to spot on the TV.Also,  I would keep the special offers, I've found many good deals with the special offers and they don't pop-up. They're only there when you open the Kindle and you have the option to ignore it or open it to check it out.I can't find one bad issue with this HDX. Even the battery life is very good. I left it on with the internet all day yesterday (well, for about 12hrs anyway) and finally plugged it in with 29% still left.Thanks Amazon for another great product!!!

Reviews.Title: Amazing tablet
Reviews.Author: Donna
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my husband and we both love it, so easy to use and the picture and sound is amazing, so clear. I am so happy I chose this one, the front and back facing cameras not only take beautiful pictures but Skype works perfectly.  We also tried the Mayday button with a question, this is a great feature.  We totally recommend this tablet to everyone any age you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: worrisome decision, glad I bought
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Ya-ya"
Reviews.Content: I have owned 2 versions of iPods, got fed up with them because I replaced 2 screens.  I even had the last iPad in an otter box case!  I am 67 and travel often and wanted something not so expensive thinking that might be a reason I've damaged the ipads.  Since I'm a Prime member this seemed to be a good choice. I also owned a Nexus 7 and a Galaxy Tab 7".  I like this Kindle more than the Nexus and Galaxy. It's faster. I like the bookmark screens. The screen is sharp and the audio without ear buds is excellent.  I sold my iPad, gave the Nexus to my son for an extra gadget for his family.  I have an eight year old son who loves the full size iPads, but he never complained one bit about using the Kindle when he visits me.  I bought the warranty after reading reviews about service.  I'm not a big electronics warranty person, but after broken screen disasters in the past, thought it might be wise.  I haven't tried the May Day feature. I have done fairly well with their experimental streaming video on links like CNN.  I like to use instructional videos on you tube and the app I'm using doesn't always show the picture.  I guess when I get annoyed enough with that, I will try Mayday.  I use the Kindle Fire HDX for email, surfing, video and once in awhile listen to my Audible books with it.  My grandson loves YouTube Lego videos, movies, tv shows and games.  The Apple app universe is huge, but I have found more apps than expected or would use. It is a very good size.  I bought an inexpensive case for it,  I think I would prefer the origami design.  This may not be the best place to mention this, but oh how I would love for Amazon to come up with a recommend video program like Netflix does.  I think trying to find something to watch in movies or tv is a little tedious unless you know exactly what you want to watch.  Love the Netflix rec that says based on your rating of .... we recommend this.....last, I know there was some brouhaha over Prime membership prices, but I still think it's has offered very good value for me.

Reviews.Title: Best in class Amazon tablet!
Reviews.Author: American Shopper
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" is the best tablet i have ever owned! The screen is very crisp and beautiful, processing power is comparable to the iPad (maybe even better), and the battery life is superb. Many reviews I've seen complain about the limited apps in the Amazon Appstore, but so far, their appstore has what I need. The speakerss on this machine are by far the best of any tablet. If you're the kind of person who is worried about the tabket you should get, i would highlt recommend the Kindle  Fire HDX.

Reviews.Title: Shallow Learning Curve, Superb for Reading, Viewing, Listening
Reviews.Author: D. L. Keur "write novels as E. J. Ruek"
Reviews.Content: I'm Smartphone and Mac phobic. I hate icon driven. So why in the world would I even consider a Kindle when the command line is where I live on computers.  Because I'm tired of hauling dead tree books around.  And, after years and months of wavering, I went ahead and decided to try one--the biggest one...because I don't like "little" and I don't like plain.  Well, the shock of the icon driven system lasted about a day.  And, yes, while I'm still learning all the ins and outs, it's very user intuitive. Plus there's that magic instant live help if you're near a wifi connection. (And they really do answer instantly, too.)  i have no complaints, whatsoever...except for one small thing: It's addictive to read on a Kindle, and, if, like me, you're already addicted to reading, you'll find yourself even more so, because reading on a Kindle HDX 8.9" is pure heaven. Think you read fast now? You'll come close to doubling your reading speed, if you're anything like me.  No page turning, no stopping when you need a sip of your favorite beverage (get an otter box for it, too, btw). In short, this machine revolutionizes reading.  My one OTHER suggestion: get a couple of those packages of styluses for it. It will make it easier for you to navigate around while learning the 'how-to's.  Also helpful for the really tiny links that sometimes can frustrate you surfing with the onboard web browser.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet at a great price
Reviews.Author: Ted E. Richardson
Reviews.Content: It is amazing.  My daughter even offered to trade here Ipad3 for it.  The rear camera is great.  The colors are bright and true.  It is light and the battery life is good.

Reviews.Title: Fantasitc Plaything
Reviews.Author: Vicki Hopkins, Author "Vicki Hopkins, Author"
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Kindle Fire 7" last year on Amazon.  Since it was my first Kindle, I thought it was pretty good.  My only complaint was the weight.  Holding it while reading a book made my wrist tired.  My 29 year old son tried it one day, and I let him take it home to use on a loan.  That was six months ago, and it's obvious it's not coming back.  So today I went to a retailer who had one in stock on sale (hate to wait for things to arrive) and purchased this instead.  I'm in love.The unit is much larger, lighter, better sound quality, awesome picture, and great camera.  As an author, it's great to look at my own books and even hear my own audio books on the unit.  It lets me know what my readers and listeners are seeing and hearing to use for my own quality checks. Besides that, I can do so much more for my own entertainment.  Everything works fine on the unit.  Easy setup.  I couldn't be happier with my purchase.  The price was in my budget and a more affordable guilty pleasure than other expensive pads on the market.

Reviews.Title: My first tablet and I love it!
Reviews.Author: Lil' Bob
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" is great - easy to set up and easy to use!  I'm sure there is a lot more for me to explore!

Reviews.Title: Better Than iPad Air for Speed and Amazon Instant Videos
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: Researched this purchase for a month.  Very pleased with the 8.9 HDX.  I use an iPhone 5 daily and own a first generation Kindle Fire.  We have several iPads in the family and I even bought an iPad Air only to return it when my Amazon Instant Videos would not download to completion (I'm a big Breaking Bad fan).  The Kindle Fire 8.9 HDX is amazingly fast and smooth.  Better than the iPad for speed and just as easy to use if you have any experience with the Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet to use for your personal presentations
Reviews.Author: donald fournier
Reviews.Content: I am a certified Microsoft System Administrator.  However, I have always stayed away from tablets as I work with workstations and servers.  I was finally drawn into the tablet market when I saw how well the Kindle fire 8.9 HDX could play videos.  My main concern was the cost of having to pay for 4G option to be able to have access to the internet all of the time.  I opted out of the 4G option and went with the 64 GB for the following reason.  I can sideload ( another way of saying copying files from your pc to the kindle via the usb cable) many of my MP4 movies and photo charts and mp3 music files ot my Kindle.  I can even make a folder on the kindle when connected to my pc using the pc to do the work.  So, you can have personal folders for putting all of you material into an organized matter.  You can also turn off "auto update to personal cloud" so you do not go over your personal 5GB of space free.  The battery stays charged longer when wifi is off (known as airplane mode which you can set on your kindle).  I had to order the 64GB directly from amazon as Best Buy does not carry the 64GB option.  I have placed a lot of charts, books and personal videos and personal music files on the kindle and still have only used up around 5 GB of space with around 49 GB still available.  The 64 GB model actually uses around 5+ GB of system memory so you end up with around 58 GB available for storage space when you first turn it on.The back camera takes a very high quality movie file in mp4 format.  It played back upside down at first on my pc but I used premiere to flip the video and exported it to a straight up video.If you take a picture with the back camera you will get a very high quality photo.  The catch is that if you email the pic to yourself it will be of a size around `1600 x 1200 picture.  If you hook it up to your computer via the usb cable then you will find it under a Dicom folder looking for camera then look through the subfolders and the file will be located.  copying from the dicom folder to your pc will end up giving you the maximum size of the photo without being sized down.  So it is extremely high resoulution at 300 dpi.Also if you want to turn off the auto to personal cloud  you will go through the settings device storage personal movies settings and buried that deep is the option to turn off auto load to personal cloud.  recommend you turn that feature off.The speakers give you great audio for personal use while you may need to use an external speaker for a louder sound.  In mentioning this the Bluetooth external speakers around 49 and below do not play any louder than the speakers you all ready have so you do not need to purchase a blue tooth speaker unless of course you get a high end one with high gain at 100 dollars or more.I would recommend this (64GB) to anyone who has lots of mp4 videos and charts and pictures and music to sideloadI played netflix on my kindle via the wifi in Books a Million and it played great.  No dropouts.  Make sure you go through the kindle store to get the right version.  Tech support is only a button away and they really are professional in what they do.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect ...
Reviews.Author: Gerard T. Lee "gtkyl"
Reviews.Content: The HDX is a great tablet except for one thing ... it keeps dropping it's WiFi connection .... this is a PITA when watching films, browsing the net or checking email ... If they can come up with a fix, I would give it 5 stars ...

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Grammar Police "Moms"
Reviews.Content: If you are on the fence about what to buy, I'm going to be pretty simple here.  I have owned several ipods, an Ipad2 10" and an iPad mini.  I still have the ipod and the mini, and when my Ipad2 went on the fritz, I was debating whether to replace it with an iPad Air or a Kindle Fire.  I have always believed the ipad was superior and the Cadillac of all devices.  But the cost!  And I hate iTunes.  Apple does their updates and they never seem to care if their customers are having problems or not.  If something goes wrong with your device, you had better have an extended contract, because they won't fix anything.So, tired of Apple and iTunes, and all the hassles that come with it, I decided to look into Kindle.  A friend gave me the Kindle Fire HDX with 64g as a gift.  My first impression was OMG at the beautiful screen.  It is so clean and clear and just gorgeous!  A little smaller than a 10", but come on.  Not really noticeable.  Watching movies and everything else is just plain great.I was very surprised that a lot of my Apple products automatically synced with Kindle with no hassle whatsoever.  I also have a Energi charger for my iPad that also works with the Kindle!  I was amazed.Mayday, where you have access to 24/7 help, is awesome.  Where else can you get service like this?  Try and even find a live person on Apple to help you.  I dare you.  I was having trouble with setting up music and they walked me right through it.I found it difficult to figure out setting up music and movies.  I was used to iTunes and I just couldn't figure out the Cloud Player.  I find it sort of clumsy, but after I figured it out it was no problem.  Amazon books and music are cheaper than iTunes.  I have an Apple TV and now Amazon plays on there as well.I read that getting 64 gig wasn't necessary.  Well, music and movies and photos take up most of your space.  Even though Amazon doesn't allow you to have a ton of videos on your device, we always end up using more space than we think we will.  On my Apple devices, I have my music and audiobooks on my ipod.  I put my photos on my computer.  The rest goes on my Ipad.  With Kindle, I can pretty much put it all on one device, if I choose to do so.Amazon Prime does not have the movie and tv selection for free that Netflix or Hulu have.  They need to work on that.  But the free shipping more than offsets this little glitch.I also love Amazon because you can get help.  If something goes wrong or you get a product you don't like, they make it right.  You get your money back and they help you and they appear to listen.  So I am a big Amazon fan and always will be.  In this day and age, customer service is important to me.Lots of neat little features.  Too many to go into here.I do not like the email, the way it is set up.  Confusing and just pretty much hate it.  I get emails much quicker on my ipad. Don't like the keypad.  It's a little different in that the space bar is small and there's a period next to it, so I keep hitting the period.  Little stuff I don't like, and it doesn't matter in the scheme of things.I don't have an Ipad Air, but from what I've read, it's probably awesome.  But I got 64 gig of memory and an awesome tablet with wonderful features for $439 on a Kindle.  Try buying an Ipad Air with 64 gig and see what it costs you.I think it all comes down to what do you want from your tablet, which will probably last you about three years.  If it doesn't go bad, technology will move forward and you will want to replace it.  I think Amazon hit a home run with their Kindle HDX.  I have had it a couple weeks and I absolutely love it.  Oh, and by the way.  I did not get the Origami case for it.  I bought a bundle called DigitalsOnDemand and it gave me the most awesome leather case, sleeve cover, stylus pen, USB cable, chargers, etc...  a steal for the money.  The screen protector was a piece of junk, so I got the Moshi iVisor XT.And best of all.  Try it and if you don't like it, send it back.  You can't go wrong.  You can't do that with Apple.

Reviews.Title: Even a seventy year old can use it.
Reviews.Author: NC. movie man
Reviews.Content: First off I want to say I know nothing about computers only how to turn them on and off but I love to read I saw the 7"HD and wanted it. My son fell in love with it so I ordered the 9.8 HD because of the bigger screen loved that so I gave my son the 7" the 9.8 HDX came out I wanted it for the mayday. The others I had no trouble getting the wi-fi working but this one no matter what I did it would not connect so I hit the mayday a very nice young girl came on I told her my problem. She asked if she could take over my screen I told her by all means so bless her heart she did everything she could to connect it for me, she told me I had to get a number from my IP what ever that is so I call the telephone service they gave it to me, well I hit the mayday button again, this time an older man came on I told him what the little girl did and about IP he said I didn't need that he took over in 10 seconds it was up and running. Have not used it again but it's so nice to know it's there for old farts like me. I say jump on it, get the protection plan if you are butter fingers like me you will need it. There is no hue around the screen like I have read, I can't see for the life of me why some on here has been giving it one star. The picture is so clear the sound I am hard of hearing had to use head phones with my others I can hear this one very well. I can take pictures of my grand kids and e-mail them to my computer after my son showed me how. Word of advice don't buy a cheap cover the back camera will not slide up to take them it's a pain taking it out of the cover. Oh yes one more thing I didn't know anything about the point credits on my prime card I came across them by chance at the time I made up my mind to go for it, between the points and the one time fifty off  I only paid one hundred and twenty five dollars so check for them. Hope you enjoy it as much as I do.

Reviews.Title: Best tablet I've used, and I've used many.
Reviews.Author: J. Peck "j peck"
Reviews.Content: Amazon has really hit the mark with this one. The Kindle Fire HDX is awesome.The Fire OS is very nice. Most apps are available now in the Amazon store. The screen in amazing. Best of all is the size. It is a little smaller than an iPad, but I think this is a plus. It is only slightly smaller, but is lighter and easier to grip. It can easily be wielded with just one hand when reading. Also, the built-in tethering works perfectly.I also love the tight integration with Amazon's media. I have always preferred to buy my music, books, and movies from Amazon not Apple because I can use them on Apple, Android, Fire, Linux, the MP3 player built-in to my car or just about anything else. With Apple's store you are locked in to their products.I have owned an Kindle Fire, iPad 1, iPad 3, iPad Mini 1, iPad Air, and this tablet. The Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 has definitely been my favorite. The iPad Air doesn't really compare.I highly recommend this tablet. You will be impressed.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Suz
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle.  Have loaded a few apps....you tube,  time warner cable....works perfectly.Love it!  I waited 2 years to buy a tablet because I couldn't make up my mind about this one or theSamsung Galaxy,  broke down and bought Kindle.  Awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: Nice Tablet
Reviews.Author: Aaron
Reviews.Content: Got this as a thirty day trial and have decided that since it's still refundable until January 31st I will hang on to it a bit longer. Great display and quite a nice device. I've put games and several movies on the tablet and have been impressed with both sound and picture. My son and wife love the games and the access to Amazon market place.  There's really no downside to the tab other than our family are pretty much exclusively Apple. We have iPhones, iPods, iPads and even Apple TV.  I can't really integrate this tablet into my fold as well as I'd like to. The browser it has is quick and I enjoyed using its web browser Silk.  Compared to the Apples browser, it keeps up perfectly.  It also has a bit higher pixel rating.  Depending on whether I go through with returning this or not, I will review it in more depth after the holidays.

Reviews.Title: great product easy to set up and at a good price.
Reviews.Author: terrence kalicharan
Reviews.Content: this is a good tablet for the price and its pack with features than any of the other brands in its class, love the hd resolution and everthing is easy to slide without that irritating lagging, front and rear camera's and a lot of apps, the live customer help is great and very little wait time, I bought this as a gift for a friend but I like it so much I want to get one for myself....more....easy to set up and is very lightweight...great Christmas gift for someone you LOVE.  I can't find anything bad to say about the product..Kindle did well.

Reviews.Title: Replaced my home computer
Reviews.Author: James Burr
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th Kindle (I keep upgrading) and it is by far the best.  I have used this and no longer need a home computer for almost everything I do.  I keep finding nifty features every time I use it.  The display and sound are great!

Reviews.Title: New Kindle Fire 8.9HDX
Reviews.Author: Kate M.
Reviews.Content: Received my new Kindle Fire HDX 8.9  on time as was scheduled by Amazon.  Light weight asthey indicated and user friendly.  I want to learn more about this tablet as soon as possibly...I really like the new covers that have the opening for the charger and volume control...also theoff/on button has a hole in the cover.  Im hoping the mayday will really help me also..cantwait to get going on it.

Reviews.Title: I really like this tablet
Reviews.Author: John D. Guenther
Reviews.Content: I have had my Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" for about four weeks now, i really must say I really like it. It lives up to everything I expected from it with a couple of very minor issues. The screen is fantastic, I find it very easy to read books on this screen. I bought it mainly to put my database manuals and find it well worth the investment for that purpose. I also find my photos look much better on the this screen than on other tablets I have played with.The minor issues I had with it were with apps I would like to have that are not yet available for the Kindle Fire. Not being able to easily install apps from the Google Play Store is a little annoying but not a deal breaker by any means. I highly recommend the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" tablet to any one who is looking for a light weight tablet with the best screen I have seen and great performance.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Product
Reviews.Author: MMPdel rio
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HDX is everything Amazon claims it to be.  Probably one of the best, if not the best tablet on the market.  The screen color and resolution is unbelievable.  True HD! The help feature is outstanding.  You just tap the help button and a real person pops up on your screen in about 10 seconds.  I used the help function a couple of times during the set up process and was more than impressed.  Another great feature was that everything I had on my old first edition Kindle Fire transferred to the HDX as soon as I turned the unit on.  All books, apps and all the data in the cloud came right up.  If you are a current Kindle user I recommend you upgrade.  If you are not a Kindle user buy this one.  The only thing I wish the Kindle would do is allow you to download a different internet browser; Chrome would be my first choice.  The browser, Silk, that Kindle uses is OK but I would like to have a choice.  Bottom line, great product.

Reviews.Title: BEST K FIRE I HAVE OWNED (4th)
Reviews.Author: ajs_fla
Reviews.Content: I have owned at least one of every version Kindle Fire since the first.  I have always been hapy with the tablets features etc for the price.  Have a Fire HD 8.9 which is a nice tablet but at time thought it was a bit sluggish if i opened a spreadsheet on it using a 3rd party app.  When the HDX was announced I knew i needed itbecause of the processor.  Bought it from a brick & mortar just on timing issue.  I am really happy with this tablet.  By far the best Fire yet.  Amazon has a great product to go with their great service

Reviews.Title: Downloading Amazon Prime to the device for the WIN!!
Reviews.Author: Ryan S.
Reviews.Content: I'm travelling a lot more for work now and bought this device over any other device (iPad, Android, etc.) for the ability to download Amazon Prime videos to my device for NO EXTRA CHARGE!!!  It truly is the best tablet on the market.If you plan on downloading a lot of full HD videos make sure you buy at least the 32 GB version, with all my apps installed I was able to download about 8 episodes of full HD Doctor Who with my 32 GB tablet.  A 16 GB probably wouldn't have downloaded enough episodes to get me through one full flight.

Reviews.Title: A Great Gift
Reviews.Author: Rodney J. Case "rodnick"
Reviews.Content: It does everything I need. 'A beautiful combination of everyday computer tasks: email, reading books, buying, getting information, watching tv o r movies, and much more. It's all within the touch of a button. It meets my needs even before I'm aware of them. 'GREAT SOUND AND PICTURE.

Reviews.Title: Better than any IPAD  that I have researched for!
Reviews.Author: Mary Von Elling
Reviews.Content: AWESOME! AWESOME! AWESOME! Can't brag about this KINDLE FIRE HDX enough! MY son & I simply love the features available on it and the free stuff that came with it such as the extra game coins for game apps.I've never owned an IPAD but this is so easy to handle and learn from. A great price for an awesome IPAD.It has such a great screen and great sound. I love the MAYDAY Button. I was not born into the technology generation so Amazon took care of any question that I had to ask them. My son has autism and he likes the voice activation of the unit that speaks out each time you touch the pad and gives him that social activity feeling that he requires.After checking with Consumer reports it gave me the same conclusion of an all around great Kindle for a great Price.

Reviews.Title: Amazon delivers
Reviews.Author: Madscientist "lcjr2002"
Reviews.Content: Finally Amazon delivers. An awesome tablet in every aspect. Side by side comparison to iPad Air, the HDX has a noticeably better display and better viewing angles. Better colors. Amazing performance with no lag (the iPad Air also has amazing performance with no lag). This tablet truly provides a great user experience, instant response. Games run smoothly with amazing graphics. The display is impressive. Full HD movies play with no lag. The tablet provides great multitasking, watching a full HD movie while running some calculations in a spreadsheet application, no video stutters. The Mayday feature is awesome. Sound is great. This tablet is a winner and you cannot go wrong here. The only disadvantage to some is that this tablet is integrated with the Amazon ecosystem and does not provide the official Android operating system with the GooglePlay store out of the box (though it could possibly be rooted to do so later). If not having official Android is not a problem and you are fine being tied to the Amazon ecosystem, this is the best tablet. Finally giving Apple's iPad real competition for a lot less money.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: R. Vazquez
Reviews.Content: Purchased the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" in late January.  Three months in, it started to do the infamous reboot a lot of consumers have reported.  Amazon's solution is to send you a refurbished device.  Somewhere some poor soul will be receiving mine.  This is unacceptable and bad business.  Don't let the scripted customer service rep read you some spiel about your ISP and WIFI to try and pass the buck.  I build computers and am very tech savvy.  I am also street smart and know when someone is trying to hustle me.  The good part is i paid for this lemon with the Amazon store card.  That means that Amazon is going to have to keep sending me a Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 whether its refurbished or out of a trash bin at their warehouse for as long as i have a balance on their card.Rest assured that in the end i will get my moneys worth one way or the other as i am in no hurry to pay off this card.  When the 1 year warranty expires and you are still sending me refurbished junk, make sure that you keep doing it without charging me because at this point it will be YOU/AMAZON that ends up getting screwed, not this consumer.

Reviews.Title: Amazon tether
Reviews.Author: Russell D. Glynn "kimiko dad"
Reviews.Content: I am impressed with the technical specifications and the price is competitive. But for all users but the computer challenged, this "tablet" is not a good choice. For some inane reason, Amazon seems to be in a war with Google. You can't download Chrome, or any other Google apps like Drive, Contacts, Schedule, or Maps. Many of apps they offer in their proprietary store receive low user ratings. You cannot remove Amazon apps from the device.

Reviews.Title: Great Job Amazon !!!
Reviews.Author: Laptopbs
Reviews.Content: It seemed like a long time for the release date to come around, and it was well worth the wait .. and every penny of the cost.As others have described the screen quality was stunning. Not good or even great, but stunning.I have only had it a few hours but it seems real fast and very light and easy to hold. I get most of my media (video rentals, MP3's and books) thru Amazon, so this purchase was a no-brainer for me.I read some earlier tech reviews discussing available productivity apps on tablets....yeah right.This will be my UN productivity tool for my real life. Pretty much all the media access I could ever want in a small, well designed packageGood work on this product.Did I mention the screen quality made you think "wow !" in amazement?

Reviews.Title: replaced with a USED device
Reviews.Author: Janie
Reviews.Content: I have had several Kindles over the years and have loved each and every one of them.  I was excited when I received the 8.9HDX as a birthday gift, unfortunately the device died in 5 weeks.  The screen went totally black and the unit needed to be replaced.  Amazon quickly sent me another device , to my surprise it was a refurbished one.  Had mine lasted even 4 months and then died I would not be upset with a used device as a replacement... however I barely got to use mine before it died which means my husband paid 444 dollars for a USED kindle as far as we are concerned... and we are sure had we not sent the defective one back we would have been charged the price of a NEW unit, even thou that was NOT what was sent to us.  Given how brief my time was with a new one and the fact that we have no idea how much time and wear and tear is on this replacement we are very dissappointed in AMAZON and their so called quality.

Reviews.Title: Replaced my iPad with the Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Deborah Theall
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous about replacing my iPad with a new tablet.  This was the best decision I ever made.  It takes a bit of getting used to if you have used the iPad for awhile but I have never regretted my decision to replace my iPad with this tablet.  I would absolutely buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Love IT
Reviews.Author: Mountain Marm "Linda Frost"
Reviews.Content: This is my third Kindle, and they just keep getting better.  It has all the features I wanted, and, having had an HD, I was already familiar with the platform. The graphics are wonderful, sound quality is much improved, and apps run much better. I added the Belkin Bluetooth Keyboard Cover and Office Pro app and turned it into a mini laptop.  I can produce documents and presentations, take notes at meetings.I also use my HDX for recreational purposes and read rather prodigiously  The dictionary has been upgraded and includes Wikipedia for further info on topics.  Yes, I'm a researcher who likes to learn trivial knowledge good for crosswords.  Yes, the crossword apps run better and have more features on the HDX than on the HD.All my apps are automatically downloaded to both my HD and HDX, so  I can instantly compare them.  I am disappointed with Facebook and Ancestry apps, however.  Neither one works as advertised.  With Ancestry, it may be the fault of the app, but Facebook simply does not perform up to the expectations as advertised.I assume this is a problem with the app?  Anyway, this is a bit of a disappointment, although a minor one.I highly recommend the new HDX 8.9 and, depending on your needs, recommend adding a Bluetooth keyboard of some kind, so that you can turn it into a mini laptop.  With the integrated keyboard cover, I close mine up, put in my handbag , and I'm off to the next stop.  It's always with me if I need it, if not for work, for play.

Reviews.Title: Love my Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: Jbug10
Reviews.Content: It s faster than my ipad, the picture is sharp and clear.  Just watched my first movie on it, it was wonderful as clear as being in a theater except smaller.  only con is not as many apps as the ipad, but I still love it!

Reviews.Title: Great device
Reviews.Author: Barbara A McKinzie
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire is clear, crisp and easy on the eyes.  Great device for color pictures and games, outstanding clarity.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: Daveg61
Reviews.Content: Best decision I ever made.  Battery life is good, great picture.  Easy to use, you can do everything you need to.  If you're still thinking about one, stop thinking and order one..you won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: My Kindle is quite possibly my soulmate
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "Fosterocalypse"
Reviews.Content: I am in love with my Kindle. It is the best electronic device in my arsenal. Highly recommended. For anyone who loves awesome stuff.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle Fire HDX 8.9
Reviews.Author: Barbara Reid-James
Reviews.Content: I chose it especially for the rear facing camera, and I enjoy using it.I would recommend it to anyone i know who wishes to buy a tablet.My only problem is that my geographical location restricts some apps.

Reviews.Title: Love my HDX
Reviews.Author: J Allison
Reviews.Content: I love my HDX.  The main selling point for me was the May day feature. I've used it several times and the people were so helpful and polite.The response time was  very fast and my problem solved quickly.

Reviews.Title: Blazing fast
Reviews.Author: Jim White
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle fire. It is blazing fast and very lightweight. However there is one drawback that I have found. On some of my  books especially the Bibles there is no Table of contents.

Reviews.Title: Love the fire
Reviews.Author: Indy
Reviews.Content: Wonderful love love love it!!! I haven't even begun to do all it's capable of. The best tablet on the market!!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: William S.
Reviews.Content: The picture resolution is outstanding.  Coupled with the slimness, weight, and excellent relocation of the power and volume controls makes the HDX a must!

Reviews.Title: Good price point, terrible introduction.
Reviews.Author: Don Moriarty "Space and Time are what we seek...
Reviews.Content: Why get Amazon Kindle Fire? Price, need a tablet, want a tablet, buy most your products off Amazon.When I first got it, I was in need of downloading a file manager or else I was stuck wondering how to access them. My head was hurting at trying to find apps I might actually use. My head still hurts while attempting to find games I would like that are both paid and free. No Google Play store, so Amazon forces you to buy their products. There are ways around this, but it has been a few weeks so far and I have not even found many apk files I am happy with. I swear Amazon would sell nearly 10 times more tablets if their tablet were already rooted, and I would be willing to pay an extra $50 to Amazon for this feature.Samsung Galaxy phones are rooted and I buy things from Google Play because there is more, but I also use Amazon shopping app for when I am not at home. If Amazon were to contract for Google Play on their tablet, it would solve at least 80% of my problems with this thing and likely make Amazon a ton of money off Google's apps through the tablet. Of course, some CEOs of Amazon might not consider this, or there might have been contract negotiations but they were not in agreement. Could just be that CEOs are not the brightest in the company.I love Amazon, I love most of the ways they handle their business. I just do not like some of their marketing schemes, or most of them. With talks of Amazon now in favor of closing off online tax loopholes they once used to gain their wealth as a company, to an increased yearly subscription fee which is marketed mainly for their video services, to the best of the low-priced tablets forcing you to spend money on them even though they can make more money by catering to the consumer's wants.I bought my Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" Wi-Fi 64GB for a decent price. I think the current price is steep, and would suggest buying for substantially less until they can either "root" it or add Google Play so that you feel the need to use it more than you think you might. I was thinking of nearly selling it back to someone just because of the headache. Do yourself a favor though, and take a look at it carefully if you know someone who has this.The screen is bright, you can get many apps still off the web built in to the software, and overall am satisfied with this machine only because I know my way around roadblocks with computers and phones. If you like to read, watch movies, browse the web this is a great tablet. If you like to play games or are not much knowledgeable about current tech, I suggest against buying this. Oh, and it only seems to use keyboard controls, not gamepad controls. Look up Red Samurai gaming controller, it costs only $10 at GameStop and works well with the tablet.

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle Fire HDX 8.9"!
Reviews.Author: Carol P. Alvarez
Reviews.Content: It does everything I wanted it to do and more.  Besides using it as a reader, I use it for e-mail. With the Office Pro app, I do Excel spreadsheets and Word documents.  The camera is great, and the pictures are easy to download to the PC or send via email or share on social media.  Surfing the net is a breeze.  The Kindle store has loads of great apps--many of them for free.  I am very pleased with my purchase and would definitely recommend the Kindle Fire HDX to others.

Reviews.Title: Reading and Viewing In The Lap Of Luxury
Reviews.Author: JPP Smorenburg
Reviews.Content: I bought the HDX 8.9 as an International Customer located in Holland. This means no Mp3 store, and no video streaming for me. This could be a showstopper when contemplating the HDX in my situation. I've had every Eink Kindle except the Kindle 1 and the big DX. I've sold my old models when upgrading to the newer device. My most recent Eink Kindle was the Paperwhite 1 3G. When upgrading, and passing on to my son the Kindle Fire HD 1, 7" to get the HDX 7, the latter gave me such a good reading experience (in addition to the much improved browser, speed and form factor) that I sold my Paperwhite 1 3G without upgrading to the Paperwhite 2, and switched fully to reading on KF HDX LCD. I had to get used to it, but I read several hours per day, without complaint and the only gripe I have is the lesser battery time compared to an Eink Kindle, although the lighting has speeded up the drainage in the Paperwhite.  In practice, the battery life is quite sufficient to last a full day of reading and surfing the web. When comparing the HDX 7 with larger tablets in shops, I found the bigger screens very comfy for reading and surfing. That made me buy the HDX 8.9. I thought for a long time about buying the ipad mini retina, but the HDX 8.9 had a bigger screen for less (32gb version) and the awesome integrated Amazon experience and after sales. Plus, the Kindle reader software  is the best, more optioned out, on a Kindle device. The geographical mp3 and video restrictions I took for granted, because I mostly read and surf. Plus, Spotify takes care of the music streaming for now.I'm very pleased with the HDX 8.9, it is as fast as the HDX7, and the screen is even better, in particular the more even gray reading background. The text sharpness and colors are incredible. The overall size is not too big, though the HDX 7 disappears in you hands and flips into a coat pocket and has the edge in that respect. The 8.9 weight is low, even with the wonderful origami cover. The camera is good, and the speakers are the same good quality as the HDX 7. The 8.9" screen really opens up an Ebook page, and web surfing is luxurious compared to a smaller screen. Compared to the newest iPad models screens, the HDX 8.9 does not disappoint, to say the least. To hold, the HDX 8.9 is more comfy than the Air, lighter and less slippery, and even, in my opinion than the iPad mini. On a personal note, I always liked the Fire Home screen better than the somewhat "paler" iPad home screen with the smaller app icons. The slightly compromised handling compared to the HDX 7 is a compromise that comes with the bigger screen. For me, it is worth the trade off.  Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: Useful and entertaining -- I am pleased
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: I purchased this just before Christmas last year, and it's had daily use since.  I've downloaded videos for airline flights, and off the wireless areas.  The five stars are based on this experience.  I do not miss the Google store, as I have side-loaded the apps that I needed from there, or just used the Silk browser.  I transfer and edit photos from my camera with an Eye-Fi SD cardThis is the third Kindle.  The second gen paper-white is still the best for reading.  The first Fire is still useful, but the large screen and memory makes the HDX 8.9 much better.Our household has an 4 gen iPad (16gig).  I personally prefer the Kindle overall.  Some of the apps on the iPad are better, but the video performance offline and the weight of the Kindle makes up for that.The quality of both the wireless and internet connection effects either device's performance,  The speedtest app helps evaluate the connection.

Reviews.Title: Screen is great..but have connection issues so the jury is out
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I wanted this for Christmas but didn't get it to my very vocal dismay. I bought an Ipad Mini with Retina Display as a splurge for myself (that will show em!)  I loved it! Great screen, easy to use, connected to all wi-fi spots at home and elsewhere. However, I am very committed (addicted?) to the Amazon ecosystem and am a Prime Member so I thought, why don't I go with my original choice and save a few bucks. I took the mini back and order this. As usual easy order, delivery was in less then two days, etc. The tablet seems a bit cheaper when holding it then the mini (may be psychological) but really, who cares on that. Connected easily to home wi-fi and the screen really does blow you away...much better then the mini. Watched a video or two and the speakers are great. I thought I would never use the Mayday as that was for old ladies but on my second day I did, for a completely stupid mistake (setting the time zone.) The connection was fast, the rep was great, and she didn't even laugh at me for my dumb mistake (thanks Shelby.)The bad. I have an open Wi-Fi connection at work that this device will not connect to. My Ipad connected, no problem, my phone does, even my cheap little Nook HD+ did but this thing will not. I am waiting to hear back from the technical support but having read other customers Wi-Fi issues I am on hold to see if this is indicative of some other problems with connecting. If it continues I am going to return it and go back to the Ipad Mini which worked like a little soldier. If it connected no problem I would give this a 4 or 5 star.

Reviews.Title: Great
