I use my Kindles mainly for watching videos and tv, as well as web browsing, shopping via Amazon and very occasionally checking email when not near my laptop or pc. My daughter, who is 12, is constantly using my other Kindle, so it's a good tablet for kids- very easy to use with the added security of parental control options. Something I neglected to mention in the video is the placement of the power and volume controls which are now located on the back of the tablet, along the beveled edge. I find this to be an improvement over the prior Fire HD version, on which these were located flush with the tablet's right side edge, making them somewhat cumbersome to use without feeling around or actually looking at them.

Reviews.Title: Super Display! Doesn't take long for even a novice to get up and running.
Reviews.Author: Michael "mikamu1"
Reviews.Content: I'm new to the Android scene, so it's not as intuitive to me as I could ask for.  Beautiful quality product, excellent screen.  We planned on using this mostly for reading and study, but find it handy for the ? that comes up during a movie or new event.  I'm sure there will be more to add later, since we're pretty new at it.Only complaint has to do with app availability - Went to JW.org to get their new library app and found that Kindle is one of the few it won't work on yet.??.  What's up with that?  Seems like all the other major Tablets have no issues.  Please check it out as this is a major study tools that would save us tons of time not having to be on the internet.  This is the main reason I went with 64GB.Thanks for a great product.The HDMI connect from the older model is not on this new one.  We had looked forward to downloading movies for direct plug-in to our TV. Will have to see if there is a workaround to avail ourselves of this feature.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: mgw
Reviews.Content: Upgraded my 1st generation kindle fire and what an improvement. Picture quality is fantastic and the Dolby speakers sound great.Silk web browser is fast and responsive. Light weight and nicely placed on and volume buttons. This is a great tablet that is sure to make you happy.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire HDX
Reviews.Author: nicholr gibson
Reviews.Content: I chose the kindle because there is so much that you can do besides reading books there are learning games for my son and I can also watch movies with my prime membership

Reviews.Title: Really wanted to love
Reviews.Author: dcbag
Reviews.Content: Wanted to be able to use with Fire TV but print was not bold or large enough to read, really liked being able to record prime and watch later, did not like not being able to use play store. Had to return, then purchased a 10" Sony tablet, really like it, but can't watch or record prime videos.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Bonnie L. Munn "Bonnie"
Reviews.Content: This one is the best of the lot.  I have found 16 GB more that sufficient to meet my needs and I use it everyday.  I especially like the size.  It is just right for watching movies, yet portable enough for my bag.  It has a great camera (front & rear facing).  I purchased it when it was 10% off and with my Amazon points and a gift card I paid (including tax) less that $300.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding!
Reviews.Author: Jim King
Reviews.Content: I really like the quality of the picture on my new Kindle. I had the smaller version which I like, but the larger version just blows it out of the water. More than I expected!Once again the shipping was far better than I even imagined! Amazon never fails to impress me!

Reviews.Title: Really awesome!!
Reviews.Author: Huntington Appraisal Service
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife who had an older style Kindle.  She absolutely love this Kindle Fire.  The screen color resolution is great and it is outstanding for reading books.

Reviews.Title: great device.
Reviews.Author: Gerald Vineyard
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle fire HDX.  It's very easy to use.  The pictures are Crystal clear and the sound is wonderful.  M y older fire didn't have the ability to play flash content.  This one has an alternative viewer that fills that need.  My primary need was a reader.  This device surpasses all of my requirements in that category.  Reading on this is device is a joy.  I couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Love It.
Reviews.Author: ziegler
Reviews.Content: I really love this Kindle, I use it for reading, playing games and surfing the web. It does everything I need and more. I highly recommend it. I own 3 different kindles love all 3. And yes I use them all.

Reviews.Title: Average at best.
Reviews.Author: Timothy B Bjornestad
Reviews.Content: I love amazon, and have been a Prime member for years. The HDX is a great deal in terms of content if you are already an Amazon prime member, and the quality of the screen is INCREDIBLE!However, I've found that many of the applications that I've loved on other platforms are not specifically adjusted to run well on this device. The touch parameters are off, the resolution is suspect, or the application simply won't work at all. Try THE GAME OF LIFE or Scribblenauts on it and you'll see what I'm talking about in a matter of minutes.THE ABSOLUTE WORST ASPECT OF ALL -- THE BROWSER!!! You are unquestionably limited to less than half of the I the internet because of scripting errors that arise when trying to load videos or simple page content. It is incredibly and outrageously frustrating. One last note, I wrote this using my KF HDX - please excuse any possible spelling errors.Great quality device, but until the browser is updated and applications are refined, I insist that you stick with your IPad.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: book lover
Reviews.Content: I debated over whether to get a Kindle Fire HDX or an iPad Air, but after reading comparison reviews and considering the weight, the price value for 32 gigabytes, and screen resolution, I went for the KIndle. After spending several hours today playing with my new "toy', I'm convinced the Kindle is the right choice for me. The screen resolution is spectacular, battery life is great (even with WiFi on and the brightness set at around 80%), the sound the best of all the tablets I already owned, the ease of use, the lightning fast processing, the app choices, and the totally AWESOME Mayday feature (which I only needed to use once during the setup), all terrific! I just love it!

Reviews.Title: THE PERFECT COMPANION FOR SENIOR CITIZENS
Reviews.Author: Mary A. Jarrell
Reviews.Content: I WANTED ONE WHEN I SAW PEOPLE USING THEM EVERYWHERE.I LOVE EVERYTHING ABOUT IT.I ACTUALLY BOUGHT TWO.  MY HUSBAND HAS WANTED TO LEARN HOW TO USE A COMPUTER FOREVER AND HIS KINDLE IS THE PERFECT WAY TO LEARN THE CONCEPT.  HE IS HARD OF HEARING AND WITH EARPHONES HE IS HEARING EVERYTHING.  HE HAS BEEN GLUED TO IT WATCHING VIDEOS (1940'S AND 50'S) RADIO AND TELEVISION AND LISTENING TO MUSIC FROM THE 50'S AND 60'S. IN OTHERWORDS IT'S BEEN A GODSEND FOR HIM.  HE'S RESEARCHED INFORMATION HE HAS WANTED TO KNOW AND HE HAS READ MORE SINCE HE GOT IT THAN I SAW HIM READ IN THE LAST 44 YEARS.

Reviews.Title: Tried to purchase a book and couldn't even do that!
Reviews.Author: Frank Willett
Reviews.Content: I have had it for about a month and get frustrated every time I have used it. NO USER DOCUMENTATION.  I have a couple hundred books that I had nicely organized on my old Kindle.  Have tried a couple of times to organize them on the new one and failed miserably.  Talked to a "May Day" person who recommended a use's guide book which I purchased.  It was no help what so ever.  Told me how to use the Kindle with my computer, transfer movies to the TV for viewing, use the Kindle as a telephone, etc.  All I want from my Kindle is a device for storing and reading my books.  I am disappointed.  I do need all of the features this kindle has.  I already have cameras, smart phones, computers, an iPad, etc.  I liked the functionality of my old kindle better.  Perhaps if I ever figure out how to buy, read and store books on the new one I will start using it on a regular basis.

Reviews.Title: silk browser not working
Reviews.Author: Sylbasia "Sylvia"
Reviews.Content: There were many emails b/w me and CS Phylicia about the problem with my silk browser, and she said that she would let me know the results and solution. But she just ignored me.  After about 10 days I got an email from guy name Faisal asking for another day to try to fix it and when another 2 days passed no-one called me.  However. I love kindle and the Amazon,  so I returned the broken one and ordered the new one.  So far, So good.  It working just fine.  Just after I received my new Kindle,  Phylicia left a message and was asking about a status of my broken kindle,  really?  I have  New one already. YOU ARE ALLING ME 2 WEEKS AFTER? You are lucky that I I love Amazon and I am a loyal customer.

Reviews.Title: Only one "but"
Reviews.Author: Joe from LA
Reviews.Content: This has to be the most amazing device of its kind. The USB port is a major plus. The range of free apps is impressive. Moving between languages (Spanish/English) is easy. So why 4 stars? The 24/7 instant help feature is marvellous, but not the competence of the techs. I have called many times because I wanted to know all the ins and outs of the product. Most of the techs were great, but not all. One was marginal and one was embarrassingly incompetent. Don't hesitate to get a second opinion if you are not convinced. Got my new one on EBay. Hint.

Reviews.Title: Best device on the market
Reviews.Author: Linda A. Vincent
Reviews.Content: This I my third Kindle.  I like to update every few years.  The Kindle Fire HDX 8.9", with Wi-Fi is the best.  Really cannot say enough about it.  Books, Books on tape, movies and TV shows, etc., it does it all and then some.  I will always stick with the Kindle!

Reviews.Title: Good for media consumption.
Reviews.Author: darin harvey
Reviews.Content: What are you going to use your tablet for?  I did a bit of research on the different kinds of tablets available and most guides I read suggested considering a variation of this question.  I use my tablet primarily for media consumption.  My primary concern was picking a tablet that streamed videos through my Amazon Prime account. This left me with two choices: the Kindle Fire HDX or an iPad.  I chose the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 over the iPad Air because I could get the 64 GB Kindle for less than a 16 GB iPad Air.  I was also disappointed with the letter boxing on the iPad Air when it played HD movies.  While the Kindle has a smaller screen than the iPad Air, it has a bigger picture when watching movies than the iPad.  Perhaps the iPad uses more of the screen when playing TV shows and older movies, I don't know, but it only uses a portion of the screen when playing newer movies in HD.  The Kindle Fire HDX uses the entire screen when playing HD movies.  I regularly use Netflix, Amazon streaming, and Hulu Plus and have no complaints with the HDX's performance on this front.  The speakers are more than adequate for watching movies and listening to music.  I have no experience with other tablet speakers so I can't make a comparison, but the HDX speakers are well placed, clear, loud, and don't sound tinny.  Reading on the HDX is very easy.  I have the Nook, Aldiko, Moon+ Reader, and Comixology apps, and of course the Kindle App is pre-loaded on the HDX.  The HDX is quite light and easy to hold, in either portrait or landscape mode, for extended periods of time.  I'm very happy with the battery life as well.  I get 13 hours on a full charge.  On weekdays, after work, I can use the HDX for two days in a row before I have to think about plugging it in.  On weekends the tablet will last an entire day of almost constant use before needing to be charged.  I've only ran the battery down to 0% once, and I think it took a little over six hours to reach 100%.The biggest problem with the Kindle Fire HDX is the app store.  Since the Kindle Fires are closed off from the Google Play store I thought Amazon would focus on quality over quantity with regards to apps offered, but that doesn't seem to be the case.  There seems to be an abundance of cheap, poorly designed apps and a noticeable absence of certain popular apps.  The 1Mobile Market rectifies this a bit, but I still find the absence of some popular apps in the Amazon app store curious.  I would like a Google Drive app, but have to settle with accessing it through the browser.  With a little bit of research, I've found workarounds for most problems, but it's annoying to not have simple, direct access to apps other tablets have.  I'm also not a big fan of the carousel on the home screen, but I suppose some people may prefer it.The Kindle Fire HDX has some real limitations, but on the whole I am happy with my purchase.  If you want to use your tablet for work, you may want to do some more research to make sure the Kindle Fire will do want you need.  If you want a portable media player to watch movies, play music, browse the internet, and read books the Kindle Fire HDX is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Had to return it. Too bad.
Reviews.Author: Nurturer69
Reviews.Content: I have a 7" Kindle Fire and with the sound turned up high, the sound is actually LOUD. But with this Kindle, the highest setting is like a third of the sound level of my Kindle Fire - the older version Kindle. Speaker size perhaps or ohms level, as this Kindle is half as thin as my Kindle Fire, perhaps is the reason. Whatever the reason, and to be sure there is a reason, the sound quality is weak. Know that going in.I do like the light weight. The size is nice for reading. But again, I would have expected that this being the newest, 'better' Kindle, Amazon's most expensive, would have been OUTSTANDING in every way. Obviously, they know how to do it. So . . . why is the sound weak. A disappointment.UPDATE: I returned the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9", for poor quality speaker sound. I believe if you purchase lower quality and keep it, it means you agree to the low quality. On another note, the Amazon reps were very courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: ****BLUETOOTH FEATURE NOT COMPATIBLE WITH iPHONE****
Reviews.Author: Plain & Simple
Reviews.Content: I am definitely not the type to complain however comma this is to be viewed as informing the prospective consumer.. NOT a complaint.That being said, the bells & whistles on this product are really cool.  Great display & very user friendly/intuitive.  My purpose for purchasing this device is to connect wirelessly (via bluetooth) to watch video on the screen & listen to the audio with a variety of bluetooth enabled devices.  It was difficult enough to find in the description of this product whether it was bluetooth capable or not.  My error for thinking a bluetooth enabled device will connect to another bluetooth enabled device -- this is not the case.Unfortunately, the Kindle Fire is not compatible in connecting via bluetooth with the Apple iPhone 5 (iOS 7).  Amazon tech support stated that the device will not connect via bluetooth to any Apple device since Apple is a competitor.The rep at Amazon suggested calling in advance to find out what devices the Kindle Fire is compatible with before purchasing.  I have a difficult time understanding why Amazon would not simply include a chart in the product description that outlines which devices the Kindle Fire is bluetooth compatible with and which ones it is not compatible with... that's my two cents worth!Other than that, contacting Amazon's tech support was easy & the rep was extremely helpful in assisting me with processing the return.Peace

Reviews.Title: Enthusiasts AVOID!
Reviews.Author: Christopher M Kenney
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me say that the Kindle Fire is barely 'okay' for what it is intended as - a media player.  The carousel interface is kind of neat, but more often gets in the way of finding the content you want to use at than assists in it.  That it tries very hard to direct you into purchasing new things rather than letting you get to things you have already bought and now want to use just makes it worse.  While some of the features can't be had anywhere else due to Amazon licensing terms (and the only reason this isn't getting 1 star) you know who you are if you want these.While I'll agree that a media player needs a nice screen, and this certainly has it, the problem is that the rest of its' technical specs are complete overkill for the job at hand.  You simply don't need quad-core, dedicated graphics, or massive internal storage if all you're going to be doing is reading books offline and streaming movies.  And boy, do they want you to stream over downloading.This is even further hampered by several bizarre decisions in the design.  Rear-facing speakers make it difficult to hear the thing even in relatively quiet environments without turning it up to the point where you will bother other people.  The keyboard and dictionary features are weak compared to Google's and Apple's offerings, making the touchscreen keyboard a pain to use effectively.  And the internal power management means that it often can't take advantage of the increased battery life - playing an HD movie drains the battery FASTER than a power cable can supply it.The Amazon app store is a complete joke.  My last tablet was an HP Touchpad, and before I installed Cyanogenmod the app store for THAT had easier, cheaper access to needed features.  When compared to Google Play and iTunes you just have to laugh.If all you're looking for is a cheap way to get access to Amazon content, consider the Kindle Fire HD - at over 200 bucks cheaper the minimal loss of resolution is probably justified, and you can actually connect that directly to an HDTV instead of needing an expensive new wireless setup of questionable utility (another strike against the HDX).  If you want a full-featured tablet, look at the iPad Air or one of the new KitKat-based Android tablets that should be coming out soon.Only buy the HDX if you seriously can't live without the ability to download a small subset of Prime-access videos.

Reviews.Title: Would be 5 stars except....
Reviews.Author: Don Weber
Reviews.Content: This is a very nicely done product, but not quite as intuitive as the iPad. It's easy once you've spent some time with it. The display is the centerpiece of the Kindle. It is razor sharp and gorgeous. It would be five stars except, the most irritating thing about it is, the continual dropping of the wireless signal. We only use it at home and once it drops the signal, it either has to be turned on/off, or by switching the airplane mode on and off. I contacted Kindle tech services and they had no clue as to why this is happening. There is much written about this problem on the internet. Amazon needs to recognize it and come up with a fix. I know it's not my router, because our iPad 2 and Sony desktop, never have this problem. It's still a great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: Not what we hoped for
Reviews.Author: Rebekah Price "PhantomRebekah"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mom so she could play games, Facebook, and check emails without having to fire up her computer (Windows 8 is confusing for her). It's a decent size for her, but you really need a case to hold it successfully. Here are the issues we have:1. It doesn't hold its internet connection. It says the WiFi is working & signal strength is excellent, but then it won't even connect to Amazon. To solve this, you must shutdown & restart. My plain old Kindle Fire doesn't have this issue.2. The Mayday button was the one reason this wonout over cheaper & larger screen options. The button is buried in tiny type on the menu.3. Tiny type. Vision-impaired persons who aren't  computer wizards may never be able to read Facebook or numerous other websites. Trying to enlarge something using the same technique you'd  use on your phone doesn't work here.We had to send the first Kindle back because it wouldn't hold a charge for more than 2 hours of idle time. We got a replacement within one day; however, the didn't send a new charger. They gave a credit so we could order it & promised to refund the cost of next day shipping within 3 days. I sent an email a month later asking what happened to the credit & it was posted to my bank account the next day.So overall, the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 is a bit disappointing, but the customer service of Amazon is quite good.

Reviews.Title: the jury is still out on this one
Reviews.Author: JulieMontana
Reviews.Content: Arrived as promised with packaging in excellent condition. Within 5 minutes, I had the Kindle Fire HDX turned on, connected to my wifi, it knew it belonged to me, and had my email set up. By far the quickest start-up of any device I have had. After having it a while, I do have issues with the fact that it will not let a number of my music cd's transfer correctly. I am gathering it is because they are mwav files. Using the Mayday button did not provide a lot of help. The wait for help was less than 15 seconds, but the assistant did not have any ideas why I could not see a number of my cds on the Kindle at the same time I could see through my laptop that they were in the Kindle internal storage in the music folder. He suggested I download the Cloud player, put my music on the cloud, and listen from the cloud. After several attempts to download the Cloud player to my laptop using internet explorer, I eventually got it to download properly using Google Chrome. Then I discovered you can only have 250 songs on the cloud without paying the $24.99 fee to put more music on the cloud. After picking and choosing what music to send to the cloud, I then found out you can't download from the cloud to the Kindle, you have to transfer from the laptop. Useless.  The Amazon cloud player would not accept about 20% of the songs I tried to transfer due to the wrong format(I think that is the issue, anyway). That is how I then looked at the properties of the tracks on the CDs and discovered the ones that would not transfer were all mwav files (windows media) so they must somehow be incompatible with the Kindle (or protected) not sure. So it appears my music issue is not just a Kindle issue, but an Amazon issue. Anyway, I am not happy with the fact that I can't put a lot of my music on the Kindle Fire HDX. That is why I have given it 4 stars instead of 5. I have been overall happy with the Apps I have downloaded. The location of the power and volume buttons is difficult to get used to. The screen has stellar resolution, and reading books is easy. I have not downloaded any movies to comment on viewing those videos.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet, But Poor User Guide
Reviews.Author: Peggy
Reviews.Content: Ok, the HDX 8.9 is a 5 star, great item.  This is my 6th Kindle.  (2 used by grown children, 1 to sr. citizen mother, 1 used by grandchild, and my Kindle HD 8.9 now goes to husband.) So I've grown with the Kindles, from Fire 7", Fire HD 7", Fire HD 8.9", and now the Fire HDX 8.9".  Each one has new improvements.  And up until the HDX 8.9 the user guide has been really good.  But with this Kindle, you can now use the Mayday feature and get instant help (I haven't used it, so don't rely on this info).  Apparently Amazon has decided that no one would prefer to just look it up for themselves.  So you can't.  The information isn't there. The user guide is a very shallow overview.  If you have never used a Kindle Fire, the guide will tell you how to charge, plug in to a computer, register or unregister your Kindle, purchase content, and other basics.  But you won't be able to find out how to do the new, nifty stuff.  For that, you need to contact Amazon or hit the Kindle Forum.  Which means you may not know what you're missing because there isn't anything in the user guide to tell you what your Kindle can do. I've already had to contact Amazon twice to find out how to do things I could do on the HD 8.9.  It's just different enough on the HDX that I needed info.  An adequate user guide would have been useful. Perhaps Amazon will make one available in the near future (I hope).Don't let this deter you from getting the HDX 8.9.  It's a great tablet. And Amazon has the BEST customer service I have ever used, so the answer to my questions were just a quick phone call away. I just wish I had the choice to use the user guide instead. This is especially true when I'm in the middle of nowhere, because wifi isn't always available. 4G isn't always available. Electricity and running water aren't available.  We're that kind of weekends and vacations people.The HDX 8.9 comes with a 9W AC adapter and cord to charge your Kindle.  These adapters are $20 if purchased separately, and charge Kindle Fire models, as well as phones and similar items, in half the time of standard adapters. The HDX 8.9 takes great pictures (haven't used the video function yet), and is so light, you actually feel the difference compared to the HD 8.9.  Because it's different from the HD, I'm still getting used to some differences in using features, but after a week, I haven't found anything missing from the HDX 8.9 that the HD 8.9 had, and there are lots of new goodies. It's a great tablet.

Reviews.Title: Ipad hooey
Reviews.Author: WALter Sanders
Reviews.Content: Lightweight, awesome display great battery life this is a delight to use I was hesitant at first and thought maybe an Ipad would be the way to go for my tablet needs but so far no regrets and the money I saved can go to my next new toy!

Reviews.Title: Its my prized possession
Reviews.Author: JACKIE ESSEN
Reviews.Content: This Kindle is amazing very lightweight, bright screen that is so large it is mistaken for an ipad which I quickly correct and explain the many reasons why its better!!! Thank you so much I love this product!!!

Reviews.Title: some disappointment
Reviews.Author: teri simpson
Reviews.Content: Disappointed that I can't get adobe flash on my Kindle.  I wanted to use it mostly for facebook, but without adobe, I can't open most everything without Adobe...why can't this be added???I like the larger screen....and I've used the help button once and it workedbut ----- some disappointment

Reviews.Title: good actual product
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: Love the kindle fire HDX 8.9Only really gripe I have is freaking adobe and no more android flash player!!!!But... that isn't Amazon's fault :( I basically bought this thing because it had front and rear camerasKinda hard to get good pictures but over all like I said this is a good product...don't know if I would pay 350For it again knowing what I do now though since my old kindle fire seemed to do just as good (if not better seeing as how it still has flash) 350 for an added camera that's not even amazing.... well it kinda disappointed me

Reviews.Title: Its not good for browsing the internet
Reviews.Author: Larry Hjertquist
Reviews.Content: Its good for games and video's.  The Silk browser is slow and locks up frequently.Looks good but I expected better internet browsing capability

Reviews.Title: Too limited to Amazon with common factory related problems.
Reviews.Author: Vladimir Dranovskiy
Reviews.Content: When I received this device I was really exited. It was my first tablet. The picture and video quality was excellent, the 24/7 tech support right on the device was very helpful for me, 4G LTE internet is fast. I have Amazon prime, so many apps and movies were available for me free of charge. But, I was not able to download some common Android apps and was not able to watch my internet TV, which I used watch on my TV, computer, or  even on my Android phone. It requires Microsoft Silverlight which cannot be downloaded on this device at all. After this I realized that I did not need 64 GB since Amazon limited number of videos to download to 25 even if it is YouTube short videos. Size of your storage does not mean anything. From the other site you can store things on Amazon Cloud, but you cannot use it if there is no internet. After several days I took one picture and my kindle died, became unresponsive and all CPR their tech support tried to do did not help. After new device was shipped out to me I used Amazon charger and it came back to live, but did not hold charge. When I received a new device I charged both of them to 100%, unplugged it and overnight the new Kindle still 100%, but the first one was fully discharged. I should of reviewed customers feedback before buying this Kindle Fire HDX. So, I returned both of them since they did not meet my expectations for an expensive for my budget tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great Product need Updating Fast
Reviews.Author: JLCB "JLCB"
Reviews.Content: I'm a KFire-1stGen user and really like that product. Works great, no complaints. Will keep it for reading books. Wanted a larger tablet mainly for watching movies/tv shows and just got the HDX8.9 (1/13/14) which is great except for the following issues which seems to be a prevalent concern from most everyone who has purchased this product.1. SOUND: very weak when watching videos. I have the device volume at max and the video volume at max and still had a hard time hearing the movie. I even tried ear plugs to drown out any ambient room noise and that didn't work either. Bass is really low too. I ckecked the HDX along side my KF1stGen and the KF1 sound was far better. Note: Some owners had luck installing a volume control app that includes an equalizer. Will try that next.2. NO HMDI PORT: to attach a cable to your TV to view movies/tv shows directly on your TV without having a set top box. This feature was on the KFHD, but they took it away in lieu of adding the "mirroring function" of Miracast. THIS WAS A VERY BAD IDEA, AMAZON!!!3. MIRACAST: Now, if you don't have "select Miracast-enabled accessories and TV" (specific Samsung Smart TV with Miracast, PS3-4, or a miracast dongle that you have to pay extra $$ for and stick it in the back of your TV) then you are out of luck in trying to mirror to your TV!  Since Miracast is the "new" thing it's just not available on TV's yet and you have spend more money to use this function...which if you don't want to spend the money....mirroring is basically useless. Going back to #2, Amazon should have kept the HMDI port on the HDX as a back up!4. SECOND SCREEN: Well, you can't use this either unless you get "select Miracast-enabled accessories and TVs".5. IN LIEU OF MIRACAST AND SECOND SCREEN: I've got ROKU so I tried using Plex, Twonky and USBtv to stream TV shows from KFHDX to my TV through ROKU and nothing worked. I'm not talking "live" shows. Just shows that are 2-3 episodes old. Kept getting an error on my Kindle saying "could not play in mobile view" when I was in desktop view. Very frustrating.6. MIRROR & SOUND APP/Update: It would be nice if Amazon would do a program update or make an app that allows set top boxes (ROKU, PS3-4, Blueray) to recognize the Miracast function so we could view KFHDX media content on TV and get better sound quality.FYI: KF-HDX has never had an update as of Nov 14, 2013 which is the "build date" on my device. I just tried updating it today, just in case and it said no updates available.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: RUBY E NARANJO
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised how easy it is to use this tablet...no problems whatsoever.  Love it and would recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: Better than the iPad
Reviews.Author: Barbara J. Esmedina
Reviews.Content: Fantastic tablet. I bought as a gift for my 81 year old mother and she loves it. She finally keeps  up with her email. I have an iPad I received as a gift, it is a joke as far as functionality goes compared to the Kindle Fire HDX

Reviews.Title: I Love it!
Reviews.Author: LisaLisa
Reviews.Content: I thought long and hard..iPad or Kindle? I decided to purchase the new  Kindle and I am most pleased. I have found some really fun apps and love the built in camera and video. Amazon has much to offer in apps and I just appreciate getting such a great product at such a reasonable price. This is my first tablet and I enjoy it everyday!

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Dru
Reviews.Content: Fast, light, responsive and affordable! Comparing to my iPad Air, this device is truly goes head to head with it. I would recommend this to anyone in the market for a tablet.

Reviews.Title: Truly An Wonder In Its' Own Right
Reviews.Author: Rockndaddy
Reviews.Content: The Kindle HDX 8.9 is nothing short of FANTASTIC!!!13.2 ounces with 5.1 dolby audio is amazing !!!The picture is unbelievably sharp and clear sporting an 2560X1600 HDX displaythat has 1080P falling way behind.Office Suite is preloaded so you can keep up with your office work.This little Jewel also has front HD 720 camera and an rear 8MP camera that takes vivid lifelike pictures.The action of the Silk Browser is remarkable and very easy to navigate.There is so much more about the Kindle HDX,free books to borrow from Amazon library, kids games,over 100,000 apps.The 8.9 HDX Kindle does it all.It seems like there is not enough hours in the day to use all the features of this little wonder.Now I am thinking when is Amazon going to give us an Kindle phone?

Reviews.Title: The HDX is a winner!
Reviews.Author: Elliott Black
Reviews.Content: This is the third Kindle I have owned and is by far the best.  The Mayday feature and the 4GLTE puts it over the top.  I do recommend getting the stylus to make it more readily usable.  Also, a protective case is also a must

Reviews.Title: love/hate
Reviews.Author: Teddie Nicole
Reviews.Content: I can't really tell if I love my kindle or hate it. It sometimes has trouble downloading books or music or games even when connected to Wi-Fi but when it does decide to download it downloads really fast. It has some bugs to it. Like sometimes it will freeze for a couple of seconds then start to work but it's easy to over look because when it works it works great. I think once they get the bugs fixed it will be a great tablet to have.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet, but needs an included manual.
Reviews.Author: John Shipp
Reviews.Content: Great screen.  Good colors.  Responsive touch screen.  Inclusion of the charger is a marked improvement over the original Kindle Fires which required the user to purchase a separate charger.Really, really, really needs a good user manual.  I believe that a reasonably comprehensive printed manual should have accompanied the Fire HDX.  As an absolute minimum, a comprehensive electronic manual should have been loaded on the Fire HDX prior to delivery to the customer.Pre-delivery Amazon advertising indicated that a capability to print from the Kindle Fire HDX would be available in November.  It is now December and the capability to print material from the Fire HDX is not apparent.  Might be there, but I cannot find it.  Pre-delivery advertising made no mention of having to purchase - at additional cost - an app to get the printing capability.  The advertising made the printing capability sound like something included in a software update.I have become used to the weight of my Kindle ebook reader.  I was surprised that the Kindle Fire HDX is markedly heavier - just did not appreciate what the weight specs really meant.  The polyurethane origami case adds additional weight making hand holding tiresome although the great screen makes reading a book a treat.

Reviews.Title: recommended product
Reviews.Author: Donald keith Jordan
Reviews.Content: It's seems like a great product and Amazon and everyone that works there have always been wonderful and have taken great care of us always.

Reviews.Title: A Powerhouse Tablet Experience
Reviews.Author: Ben Henthorn
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a powerhouse tablet with an amazing screen and tons of content, this is your tablet. The tablet's performance is stellar, I have yet to trip it up with any game or application. Opening applications and switching between them is not just fast, it's nearly instantaneous. The screen is amazing and puts Apple's retina display to shame. Physically the tablet is comfortable to hold, pleasing to the touch, and extremely lightweight, making it very easy to tote around the house for a myriad of uses. The speakers are top notch with crystal clear audio. The optional origami case is very useful for table-top use of the tablet, holding it at a comfortable viewing angle and standing up to repeated pokes and swipes.The OS is very content-centric and responsive with the only major downside being the lack of Google Play store access. I'm a gamer and a lot of new generation games have companion apps that are just not available in the Amazon store. A workaround is to download the .APK and .OBB files of the application and upload them through USB via a PC, but that's a bit more of a pain than it needs to be to get this kind of functionality.Overall it's a great tablet, but the lack of Google Play access is slightly heartbreaking. You can search for your desired apps in the Amazon App store and it will auto-complete your searches like it has your app, only to discover that it's not available through the AA store. It's just kind of funny that it auto-completes your searches anyway. Other than that, a stellar tablet.

Reviews.Title: Super!
Reviews.Author: Circe
Reviews.Content: I'm so excited to have the new Fire. I'm learning how to use it and need to figure out a few things. Do wish it came with a primer to learn the basics though and don't want to use Mayday for silly little things that I don't understand. I'm not very tech oriented unfortunately. I'm looking forward to using Skype when I travel and it has a great camera!

Reviews.Title: Insanely light. Love Mayday!
Reviews.Author: Kintan Brahmbhatt "Kintan"
Reviews.Content: I love everything about it except placement of volume buttons.I was blown away by May day. This is the future of customer support!

Reviews.Title: GOING WELL AFTER ONLY TWO DAYS OF HAVING MY KINDLE
Reviews.Author: Cynthia
Reviews.Content: I have only had my Kindle two days so can't be sure yet how everything works, but so far I am doing well with it.  I find that the black buttons on the black frame of the Kindle are hard for me to see however.  Wish that the on and off, etc. buttons could have been in silver or another color to help me locate them better.  Once I get to know more about the features I will update my review but for a first timer using a Kindle I will say that my ten year old granddaughter is doing great at figuring things out, thus I am not having much trouble either as she is guiding me along.  (laugh). One thing that I really wish the Kindle had was a slot to keep my stylus.  Neither the Kindle nor the case has any place to secure a stylus and that is really inconvenient to me.  Thank you.Cynthia

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny!
Reviews.Author: TamiLee
Reviews.Content: Amazing quality with a great price! My whole family loves it, hard to get my hands on it when anyone is home.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet!!!
Reviews.Author: Beverly A. Davis
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Screen & colors, Sound is incredible, & processor is super fast. Silk is a great browser. I think this is the best tablet for the money.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic device and screen with some minor flaws.
Reviews.Author: Tireguy510
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice tablet. I was fortunate to be invited to try it by Amazon for 30 days free. Light, easy to carry and FAST! Much faster than my iPad. Screen is beautiful and far superior to the Retina. I compared the Kindle side by side and WOW! Dolby speakers to boot, so you know the sound is going to be better than most other tablets. I had an Android phone before, so I already had a good understanding of the OS. That being said, here are some things that could be improved. The OS is not as fluid or as intuitive as Apple. Not a surprise here. And the battery life is NOT as advertised. The iPad can last up to three days with light to moderate use. The Kindle will run all the way down the night before, charge all night, and before 9 AM, the battery will be depleted 10%. So, I strongly dispute that claim about battery life. I have not used the Mayday button yet and didn't even know about that feature until the Kindle arrived. I really like that part of it and I think that it sets the Fire apart. It's nice to have instant help if needed and I think that Amazon is on to something here. Also, if you have Prime, this is your device. For videos, your watch list and all access to anything Amazon offers is literally at your fingertips. Same goes for shopping. It is quite easy and dangerous! LOL It was hard to stay off the Fire some days. I will be returning the Kindle due to costs, not desire. Would I recommend this? Absolutely, positively, 100% YES!!!!! It is a device that is great now, and only going to get better.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't live up to my expectations
Reviews.Author: This is not my life
Reviews.Content: I'm very unhappy with my Kindle HDX, it's slow, movies are not crisp and clear and they skip. I doesn't respond to touch well at all. I tried contacting Amazon to return this because it was one day past my 30-day window and I couldn't do it online through the return window.  I am extremely disappointed and can't believe with as much as I've spent on this and and how much I spend at Amazon, nobody cares.  I was really looking forward to getting this Kindle after reading all the good reviews, now I just get frustrated every time I have to use it. I purchased the original Kindle when it first came out, I bought my son a Paperwhite Kindle, which he loves and my other son has the Kindle fire, we are satisfied with those, but this is a big let down.

Reviews.Title: Excellent device but not for me
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I got the chance to try out the Kindle HDX 8.9" thanks to a free 30 day trial from Amazon. I've been on the fence about tablets for a long time, I consider them more of a novelty than a need and I thought this was the perfect opportunity to make up my mind. The HDX is a very attractive device, it feels good in your hand and the rubbery material looks great. It's also extremely light, The screen has an incredible resolution and looks outstanding when browsing and playing around. The sound is also excellent as well. There were a few things however I wasn't too impressed with. The Silk browser is meh at times, the app store is lacking, the buttons are located in weird spots, and the OS is just too integrated with Amazon. The OS isn't hard to get used to and the set up is easy but after about 3 days of use the novelty kind of wore off for me. It's an excellent device but I don't see the real need for it. It doesn't feel like the tablet would be able to do anything else but browse the web, read books, and watch movies. For a device that is close to $400 that isn't enough. I would rather spent the extra money on the Surface 2 which at least gets you Microsoft Office. I'm giving it four stars because I feel the device has a great build, great screen, is light, and does what its suppose to do very well. I just think it's a little overpriced and for the money there are a lot better options. The OS could use some work, either way if you love Amazon and use it all the time this is the perfect device for you

Reviews.Title: Software could use an update, but it's ok
Reviews.Author: JH

} cv_mo33PE4QAXIAWWDpreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo33PE4QAXIAWWDpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81JTzuFHyjS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_mo33PE4QAXIAWWDpreplay.parentNode; var cv_mo33PE4QAXIAWWDcurrentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html/ref=cm_ciu_vr_mo33PE4QAXIAWWD/185-2488423-4562533?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo33PE4QAXIAWWDcurrentClick) { return cv_mo33PE4QAXIAWWDcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 1:30 MinsI've had the kindle HDX 8.9 for about a week now. It's ok. I also own an ipad and I'm trying not to compare the two but it is hard not to. I agree with other reviewers that the amazon AppStore is lacking. The kindle will play amazon movies without a hitch including prime if you are a member. I've needed mayday 3 times. Twice for problems with downloading apps and once because of a problem with the camera. The answer every time is reset the device. Every time! Which doesn't work by the way. One major annoyance is that when using the rear camera while in a magnetic case there is an animation that blocks your view. It tells you to slide up your device. The kindle basically doesn't want to be in a magnetic case while taking a pictured. However, since the magnetic case doesn't interfere with taking a picture it is just annoying while I blocks your view. I hope that it will be removed in a future update. At the very least, there should be a setting option that allows you to remove the reminder alert from the middle of the screen. Other than that, the kindle is fine. You just need to be conscious of the (limited) market you are buying into.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" is a beautiful tablet
Reviews.Author: M. Epstein
Reviews.Content: Great tablet and a perfect way to enjoy Amazon Prime benefits.  Specifically, I LOVE being able to download TV shows and movies for the plane when I don't have wifi.  The tablet is fast and smart and the screen is beautiful.  I sold my iPad mini to get the HDX 8.9" and so far I'm very pleased with my decision.

Reviews.Title: Heartbroken Kindle owner going to return mine..here's why.
Reviews.Author: k9sargirl
Reviews.Content: I am a prime member , have a Kindle fire HD, and like shopping with Amazon. Initially I loved the many of the great features of the new Kindle HDX. Other reviews detail them quite well so I wont. I will add that, as a photographer, I found a great little wireless device on Amamzon to upload my picture from my sd cards (or a usb drive) on to the outstanding screen very conveniently. Here is a link to the EZOpower device..it's great with the Kindle once you sideload the app for it.B00EP13JBCNot cheap but a super work around .What I didnt know is that the rear facing camera appears to only work correctly with the Origami cases. I dislike that they need a table like surface to keep the kindle in a stable upright position so I bought a case from FInite. What I discovered (after 3 hours of very nice tech support from various folks at Amazon) is that the case causes the Kindle to think it is not ready to take a picture and therefore it stays in the instruction mode waiting for you to slide the tablet out as you would with the Origami cases. The ONLY way to get it to work it to remove the case entirely. It basically means you care forced to use the Origami case if you want full functionality with your Kindle. I got a response from Finite saying that they were aware of the problem and that all 3rd party cases have this issue to to an update done to the HDX line by Amazon in November after the cases were produced. Amazon folks were nice but said they can only verify the Oragami cases as being fully compatible with the new Kindle line. So I am very sad butgoing to return this snappy piece of technology. As a consumer I dont like having to be forced into a corner and limited by my equipment but at this point it seems that Amazon has created a problem I cant work around. :-(

Reviews.Title: Solid Device For Accessing Amazon Content, But Otherwise Very Limited
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This device has a ton of potential. The hardware is top notch and the screen is near-perfect. Some of the software features are fantastic, especially the Mayday help feature which works great and has been helpful multiple times already. The tight integration with Amazon services is a huge plus for us, since we use so many Amazon services.Unfortunately, we also use many Google services, and this device doesn't speak Google very well. Specifically, we use Google Apps for Business for almost everything online, but this Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 just doesn't allow us to use those services the same way a regular Android device would.Also, one of the things I love about Android devices is the customization, and most of that is right out the window on Fire OS. No custom launchers, no custom lock screens, no home screen widgets... and this highlights the biggest drawback for me: the Amazon App Store is just too limited. For example, I really dislike the stock Kindle Fire keyboard. It auto-corrects at the most annoying times, it doesn't learn very well, and it's generally just not very efficient. I'm used to the 3rd party SwiftKey keyboard. But that's not available for Fire OS at all. Neither is ANY 3rd party keyboard app. Most of the stuff available in the Amazon App Store is a bunch of games which are intended to separate me from my money rather than provide a useful function. Since I'm not much of a gamer, that's not useful for me. There are SOME productivity and utility apps available in the store, but very few. Nothing even close to what I can do with my Samsung Galaxy Note II.And that really sums up this device in a nutshell... there's a whole lot of things you can't do with it. About the only thing this tablet can do that an Android tablet can't do is play Amazon Videos. This device is mostly meant as an easy way to access Amazon content, not as a serious productivity tool. I was looking more for a companion device to my Galaxy Note II, but instead I ended up with something closer to an entertainment gateway.I'm still trying to decide if I want to send it back. It's not seeing much use right now. It just kinda sits on our living room table for a few days, until someone needs to use it and realizes that the battery has died. Then we plug it in to recharge it and the process starts all over again.I did try to shoehorn some Google-specific apps in there, like Gmail and Chrome. There are guides on the web that explain how to do so without voiding your warranty. But the Kindle Fire just isn't designed to handle some of the functions these apps require, and there are frequent error messages that crop up and need to be dismissed, even when you're not actively using those Google apps. It's not a very pleasant experience. We'd be better off sticking to what this device was meant for, which is consuming Amazon content.edit: it really is a gorgeous device, and that bears repeating. The screen is stunningly beautiful, the sound is clear and loud, I love every aspect of the hardware.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed - "Upgrades" don't measure up
Reviews.Author: CL-10
Reviews.Content: As a big Kindle lover, I pre-ordered my HDX as soon as they were shown on Amazon.  Two things that I really don't like:1 - There is no connection for a mini HDMI cable like there is on the original kindle Fire - the ability to easily play content on your TV is gone - and that stinks!2 - The pitch that you would be able to download Prime movies instead of only watching them in a streaming format was a bait & switch ... very few of the Prime movies are available for download.  Of the ones I checked - about 20% are downloadable - and that stinks too!I have had minor glitch with the browser crapping out.  All in all - I would have just kept my original Fire, and saved my $500 as the upgrades touted for the HDX don't measure up in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Not All I Hoped For...Lacks Versatility
Reviews.Author: Minnie I.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this version of the Kindle Fire for two reasons. First to get more storage than my original Kindle Fire and second to achieve more versatility. I definitely have more storage and can put more content on it. But the promised versatility is disappointing. The only way to "output" content from your Kindle to a TV is through Miracast. So, if you have an older TV, it HAS to have an HDMI port and you have to have purchase an adapter, which is another $60-$90.(I bought the Netgear version.)The mirroring works pretty well if you have nice, high def media. So a high def movie I created looks great; HBO-to-go streaming, not so much. The movies I downloaded from Amazon were not "highest" quality, so on larger TVs, these movies get pixelated pretty fast. Consequently, when traveling and I want to hook up this device to another television to substitute for local content, I will make sure to download the highest resolution. Good thing I got maximum storage. I'll also need to plan for the longer downloads of highest quality content before traveling and will make sure I purchase the high def versions from Amazon.I also purchased the Bluetooth keyboard. The keyboard is kind of cheap feeling--lightweight plastic. That isn't necessarily bad,I like the lightness. But the size is just a bit bigger than the device so hauling it around requires some slop in a case. I have the origami case right now, and it's okay, but I'm not sure the designers of the device, case, and keyboard talked to each other to create transport efficiencies.Also, I've found that the device is sensitive and often "quits" from an application or a book with the slightest movement. (This might be a result of the buttons on the back of the device and their interaction with the origami case.) This also is disappointing. The screen, size, and weight are outstanding. The sound isn't all it's amped up to  be but it's still pretty good for a small device. If it weren't for the disappointing versatility, I would say this provides beautiful high-def quality and a pretty good choice. But for larger display use, this device is limited. As a mobile device for doing work, it's not bad, but still doesn't offer the versatility of a Surface, for example. In the end, the amount I spent on this device and all the accoutrements could have purchased a high-end Windows 8 or similar tablet and provided me greater flexibility.

Reviews.Title: Love My New 8.9 HDX, 64GB Kindle
Reviews.Author: Kate Fredericks "Kate"
Reviews.Content: This is my 5th Kindle and by far the best yet. I am not well versed in all things technology, I just like what I like. The very first thing I noticed when lifting it out of its box, was how light it is. I truly had no idea it was going to be lighter than all of the previous versions, but the difference is, I can actually hold this tablet comfortably with one hand while typing with the other. I could not do this for more than a minute or so with my other 4 Kindles. Plus, the sleekness of the style helps, too. It is not boxy like the other versions, but curves under which surprisingly gives my holding hand a much better grip.The clarity of picture was the second thing I noticed when I fired up my knew super-duper Kindle. Everything was so sharp, it almost hurt my eyes! The third thing I noticed was the speed. Compared to my last 8.9 HD, this thing flies! The fourth thing I noticed is FINALLY a new and far better key board. I type about 80 WPM on my laptop. I know I don't type that fast on these built in keyboards, but this is the first time I have felt like I am typing on a solid, well-built tablet keyboard. It has kept up with everything I type (something the old 8.9 HD never did), and has a far better auto correct function. The auto correct function is also much faster learning words it doesn't recognize, something that drove me crazy on the old 8.9 HD.As for the battery, I am in the process of testing it now. I gave it a full charge yesterday and took it off around 5:00 p.m. I did some Twitter and Facebook, accidentally found the camera which I immediately took several pictures and movies in very low light. I have a black Lab and a black cat. In low light I literally can't get a decent picture of either of them and if I use flash, all I get are eyes (in low light). This thing took amazing pictures AND movies of both of my animals which when played back were the clearest I have been able to get them.As for the Mayday button, having owned so many Kindles, I chuckled when I read it was a feature. But when I could NOT figure out how to move some important apps from my 8.9 HD to this new HDX, I decided to give it a try. Within a minute, I was talking to a very nice young lady, who took control of my Kindle, showed me how to move what could be moved and along with me learning that my favorite weather app was not yet compatible with this one. RATS! So, I suppose you all who know electronics well might not need that button, but THANK YOU AMAZON, for the likes of me who need a helping hand now and again.I actually brought home and tried the new Windows 8 tablet and it SERIOUSLY could not even remotely compare with the old 8.9 HD let alone my new HDX which is way way better than that Surface (in my opinion). Not going to go into details here, let's just say I already know the Kindle, and after using this new HDX, I am staying with the Kindle. To get back to the battery. I have been on and off all day, and am finishing this review with 75% of the battery left! That is jaw dropping for me. I had to stay plugged into my old Kindles because I was lucky to get 3 hours doing the same thing. It has now been 27 hours and this Kindle has only used 25% of its battery?I wholeheartedly recommend this 8.9 HDX, 64 GB Kindle. It is easy to learn, easy to use, and this recent updated Kindle is like going from a small economy car to a loaded Cadillac.

Reviews.Title: Key Feature removed! (edited)
Reviews.Author: William W. Perry "RocknJo"
Reviews.Content: There are many pluses to the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9. All are plugged well on the web page for this product.There is one MAJOR negative that is not mention on the web page. The HDMI feature that got me to buy the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 has been removed from the HDX version.  I travel 90% of the time. Most hotels now have TV's with an HDMI connection. If TV is bad, I plug in the HDMI from my Kindle to watch a High def movie. I am not able to do that with the "improved" Kindle HDX. HDX has new technology which will allow wireless connection to your TV if you have the new technology in your TV. This was a deal breaker for me. I had to return my unit because it no longer does what I bought it for.Edit Dec. 23rd, 2013.  If one of the Amazon techs had told me about the miramax adaptor, then I would not have returned my HDX.  The adaptor should correct my issue of needing the HDMI. I have changed my review to 4 stars, not 5 because of the lack of good information from the 2 techs I spoke with.

Reviews.Title: Extremely disapointing
Reviews.Author: Chris Fogel
Reviews.Content: I eagerly looked forward to getting this device, but once I received it, its limitations became exceedingly clear.  In its efforts to control content and apps on the device, Amazon has limited and changed the android operating system so that only a limited number of apps work on the device.  Anything requiring JAVA will not run.  This means things like your banking app, your softphone, your cloud access apps, your local newspaper  and many other apps simply are not compatible with the device.  You can't even access the android store or Google play on the device.Yeh, the screen is nice and it runs what it runs quickly, but for my purposes it is useless.  How disappointing.

Reviews.Title: My experience in verse
Reviews.Author: Jody
Reviews.Content: I thought that I should never seeA thing as wonderful as K3.Until my Fire arrived intactWith all the color Kindle lackedNetflix was grand and music rushedTo fill the K3 void, but--The carousel displayed too much.The screen was small, the apps were iffy--But iPad 2 fixed that, in a jiffy!We were one, my 2 and I.Apps and games and 'net did fly!But as life goes, things changed and turned,And the iPad 2, for which I'd yearned,Now graces life for an unworthy other."Boo-hoo," I mourned, then went online,For an iPad 3, and thus recovered.When that one arrived at my door.A marvel of pixels, and cameras, and more,"Oh, wow!" I said, and forgot Mr. 2,There was so much surfing, and working, and playing to do.Mr. 3 was all that plus a big bag of chips.And I vowed with my heart and affirmative lips,Three was the last tablet for me--no more flips!Heh.Fickle am I, and easily swayed,A sucker for sales and payments delayed.My HDX arrived last week.So far, it's exactly the tablet I seek.Clarity, sound, and apps galore,So much speed, and worlds to explore,Poor Mr. 3 seems puny at best.Perhaps it's time to give him a rest.HDX, I adore you. I can't be wrong.At least till the next one comes along...

Reviews.Title: Not WiFi Compatible for Streaming Video except on homenetworks/Matchbooks selection inadequate
Reviews.Author: B. Davis
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire was the best that Amazon could offer but it came up short for me. As a Wifi only device it was necessary to wait almost 8 hours to download only a 28 minute episode of Alpha House of any quality at a local coffee shop.I have joined the many people disconnecting from the high priced Internet Providers. A true Wifi device needs to offer a means of downloading or streaming away from your home.The download speed was limited to 3 kbps which is typical of limited public Wifi sites. Streaming was impossible on the Kindle while my Lenovo Twist had no trouble at all streaming Netflix. Also, after purchasing hundreds of paperback and hardbound books only 6 books were available from the Matchbook Kindle special pricing(2.99, 1.99, 99) on books I already own. So sad. So the majority of any books I already own would need to be repurchased at a substantial cost to me and I found a ridiculously poor way to market the device that cost me $369.00 with tax. For the money I found the latest Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 to be a waste of money to be an expensive e-reader in today's technology revolution and with new products being released everyday.A good product needs to have added value to justify the cost of converting from hard texts to Kindle/e-books.It could not come close to competing with streaming I have on my 3 year old DroidX or my 1 year old Lenovo Twist. Battery life was nice and substantially close to stated length of operation which was the best feature, if I could have enjoyed using it.After repeated attempts to get more value or any way of improving the performance through customer service I have returned it in hopes that some day Amazon will understand their customer's true needs in the technology field.

Reviews.Title: Eats through my data plan like thanksgiving dinner.
Reviews.Author: S. INGRAM
Reviews.Content: We love our new kindle fire hdx. Everything is very impressive and works great!The only reason I am not giving it five stars is that the thing just chews through data.If I don't turn off the wi-fi or put it in airplane mode it stays connected. (even when the tablet is turned off)We live in the country and use a hot spot with 5 gigs of data per month and have never went over our limit.We have a desktop, 2-laptops, a smart tv, and an original kindle fire. and nothing chews through data like this thing.We don't stream movies or anything, but sometimes this thing will go through 2-3 gigs of data a day with minimal use.Any tips for us? We want to love our new hdx, but may not be able to afford to.

Reviews.Title: want a media tablet? look somewhere else.
Reviews.Author: Calin N Borca
Reviews.Content: Kindle,  great reading device. Amazing screen and it's fast. Why only 3 stars then? This is supposed to be a media device on top of just being able to read books. Being that most media apps from Google aren't available on kindle, that's a full star off. On top of that the battery performance is pretty poor. The lack of apps, due to Amazon's greed I'm sure, makes this less of a media tablet and more of an overpriced digital reading device. Overall, these two big negatives make me wish I would have bought another device.

Reviews.Title: Returned it, just wasn't impressed
Reviews.Author: JanJan
Reviews.Content: Sent it back and bought the newest version of the iPad.  Love iPad, the Kindle was anti-climatic.  Of course, I have an android phone (that I hate….waiting with bated breath to get a larger screen iPhone if/when they come out.  I also have a MacBook Pro.  I guess I'm just an apple girl.

Reviews.Title: Kindle MIS-Fire
Reviews.Author: Sharon Friedman
Reviews.Content: Think twice before using the installment plan!!I received 2 defective Kindles,and by the time both were returned,the plan had begun charging my credit card in monthly installments. This continued for weeks, long after I had received notices via email that I owed Amazon nothing. If you choose to use this plan, and the tablet needs to be  returned, be prepared for many long conversations with customer service.

Reviews.Title: "Totally Dissapointed"
Reviews.Author: Teresa Weber
Reviews.Content: I just received my new Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 with wi-fi and 4g. Paid a lot but at first look I loved it. Then after trying several attempts to connect the 4g with my Verizon account, Guess what? Verizon does not support the Kindle 8.9 ! Even though this very web page says that the 8.9  is compatible and runs on both AT&T; and Verizon Data Plans. Verizon does not accept it! Very angered and disappointed because I was told by an Amazon Representative that it did work with Verizon . Shame on you guys for advertising it on the 8.9 advertisement page. I am totally returning this device and expect every cent returned to me. Also used the Mayday feature it worked great. Karen a kindle representative was great and Mayday worked as advertised. And yes Karen did acknowledge that the Kindle HDX 8.9 4g is not applicable to Verizon. So there you go. False advertising ? Very Dissapointed.  Danny Weber

Reviews.Title: I hate our two iPad 2s
Reviews.Author: Pedro A. Vera
Reviews.Content: We were early adopters to almost every single Kindle ebook reader, and we picked three of the original Kindle Fire 7" as soon as they were announced. We eventually moved to the 7" HD and last Christmas I got my wife the 8.9" HDX because she wanted a larger screen.Our son had an iPad 2 as a Christmas gift in 2012 and my company issued me a second iPad 2 sometime in 2013. He likes his, but has already gone through one warranty repair for a bad GPU and three insurance claims for cracked screens (Walmart has an amazing warranty extension plus insurance, it's insane). My work iPad 2 hasn't broken yet, mostly because I don't use it. I hate the damn thing. It is slow, it is heavy and it is weird.And my hate for the iPad 2 got worse when I got the 8.9" HDX for my wife because while the screen was smaller, the device practically weights nothing. And the screen is amazing. So I got myself one too.I actually like this thing so much that many times I read with it instead of using my PaperWhite. The PaperWhite is now used mostly when I am out of the house. If I am at home I rotate between the 8.9" HDX and the PaperWhite. It is light enough that I can read or watch movies in bed, something I can't do with the iPad 2.Cons: Very hard to locate the back buttons by feel. In the 7" HD I was used to run my finger along the edge (this is in the dark) until I felt the headphone jack, but now I have to feel for the speaker grille, which tells me if I am holding the device right.  Yes, I could turn on the lights, but the idea is to turn on the device without waking up my wife.Durability: it is too early to tell, but mine has already survived a nasty fall that would had murdered my iPad 2. I had the 8.9" HDX on the holding tray on a treadmill, I knocked it over, it landed on the treadmill track, BANG, it bounced, landed on the hardwood floor, BANG. Not a scratch.Screen: fantastic. Photos look like glossy prints. Video looks incredible, no slowdowns at all. Reading is much more pleasant than on a 7" Kindle Fire (for reading purposes you can't compare the original Fire to any of the e-ink Kindles), and nicer than the 7" Kindle Fire HD (not by much, but it is better). I never play games but my wife seems to spend hours playing games on hers, never a complaint except mine whenever I see a new order for Amazon coins.Chassis: really nice, I like what Amazon did except that they could have added some kind of marking one could use to locate the buttons by touch. The buttons are better placed than on the HD 7". And it weights nothing, it is amazing how light it feels.Software: Not a problem unless you depend on Google-branded apps. If you aren't joined to Google at the hip, then you won't feel much of a difference between this and a pure Android device. You can side load without jail breaking, or you can jail break the device and risk warranty issues later, but that's up to you. I believe that for most people this is very handy, especially if you are a Prime subscriber.Sound: I prefer headphones, but my wife uses hers with the built-in speakers exclusively, and they sound very nice.Value: Even tacking a 2-year square trade warranty+insurance policy, and even taking into account that you won't get Google-branded applications, this is a fantastic deal. I expect to pick up a third one as soon as my son's 7" HD runs out of its warranty extension.

Reviews.Title: love it.
Reviews.Author: Sherion Beck
Reviews.Content: Best money I ever spent..  Perfect for what I use it for.  Research, emails.games.reading books. Even great for taking pictures. Lightweight.  Online quick tech support. Wondered if 16g would be enough for me but so far ..no problem.have had it for about 9 months now. Would not trade for any other on the market.

Reviews.Title: Nice screen
Reviews.Author: Glenn R Fitzgerald
Reviews.Content: Nice large easy to read screen. Has a nice selection of apps, ebooks and emagazines. Well worth the upgrade. I really like  how you order and read magazines from Amazon. Great device.

Reviews.Title: adds
Reviews.Author: donald hubbard
Reviews.Content: Other than the constant adds, I am basically satisfied with the device. More choices for apps would be nice. It is my third Kindle device.

Reviews.Title: Does not meet expectations
Reviews.Author: Vicki L. Duhr
Reviews.Content: Have spent many hours with Mayday people trying to work through things that should have worked right out of the box. I can't even buy things from Amazon without  having  to resort to tech support.I did not buy this device to spend hoursand hours and with tech support trying to get it to work. And don't expect much help from the Mayday support. I have been waiting  4 days so far for a supervisor to return my call on one issue and 26 days on another issue...Why these devices aren't beta tested before they send them out is a mystery.NO MAP application included...since Google maps and Mapquest need GPS to  work and the Kindle Fire does not have GPS( why it doesn't is another great  mystery).Many of the  applications in the App Store don't work on Kindle fire but you have to read the reviews to glean this knowledge.

Reviews.Title: The longer I own it, the more problems I find.
Reviews.Author: Lawrence of Sarasota "Lawrence of Sarasota"
Reviews.Content: When I first received my Kindle, I was thrilled.  They idea of the Mayday was impressive.  But, what I found is that the Kindle is not that intuitive.  Now, after 2 1/2 months, I still stumble around looking for a way to do something and have to resort to the Mayday.  That said, a number of times, the MAYDAY staff has needed to hand me off to KINDLE SPECIALIST who do not have the ability for remote access.  They have to talk you through the situation that the MAYDAY people couldn't handle.  The current problem came about when I was getting an error message on my email.  The Mayday people had to hand me off.  to the Kindle specialist.  Eventually, the error message went away but it seemed to have wiped out my contact list.  Again, the MAYDAY people couldn't handle it so, for the second time today, I was handed off to the KINDLE SPECIALIST.  He said to wait 2 - 4 hours and see if the contact list comes back.No two ways about it, the color is great!  The convenience of getting your email is good (not withstanding the problems listed above), its great for reading Kindle books, etc, etc. It just isn't the all out winner I expected.Then, there are the claims that led me to buy the Kindle such as its improved camera and screen.  It claims, "The HDX display features dynamic image contrast, a unique feature that automatically optimizes the color of each pixel based on the amount of light in your surroundings. This makes images and videos even easier to see in any lighting conditions, including outdoors."  The truth is, I have used the camera outdoors and cannot even see the icon you need to press to take a photo!!  Is it just my unit or all units?

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: John A. Lee
Reviews.Content: For the price, I thought I was buying a used Kindle Fire.  What I received was a KF that wasn't able to be registered with Amazon..thus many features were unable to be used.  I called Amazon customer service..they checked the serial number and said that it had been reported as lost or stolen, so they couldn't register it.  SO, I had to pay teh shipping back to the seller as well as a 10% restocking fee.  Won't use this seller ever again!

Reviews.Title: very frustrating
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Simmons
Reviews.Content: If you need a highly functional tablet you may be disappointed. Can't even find a simple bookshelf app that you don't have to go through a thousand steps to use. Sad.

Reviews.Title: In Love
Reviews.Author: ChaosMom
Reviews.Content: I never thought I would own a tablet. I have issues with the way first world countries abuse conflict minerals. After doing a great bit of research I decided to buy the Kindle Fire with 32 GB. It's very easy to use. It is light weight and comfortable to hold, although I do plan on buying the origami folding case to go with it and the screen protector. I feel that I received a very good bargain for the money spent and would recommend the Kindle table to anyone. I do want to note that some people find Android tablets a better platform to work from but the Kindle is a good tablet for a beginner. I have already used the *mayday* button and was answered quickly by a young man named Anthony who was eager to help and more importantly, to teach! All in all I am thrilled!

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet, Good Price
Reviews.Author: J. Lukomski
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" is a great tablet at a good price.  The sharpness of the display is fantastic and I'm glad that I purchased the larger display.  In the several months I've used it  the tablet has performed flawlessly.  I actually would rate it as a 4.5 instead of just four.  The limitation is that it doesn't support Flash and the number of apps available is still relatively smaller than available to other brands.  Haven't needed to use Help yet but its good to know the service is there.

Reviews.Title: Cautiously optimistic now that I side loaded Google Chrome
Reviews.Author: LLF1020
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of the Kindle Fire until I received the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9.  The Silk browser shuts down and even after Amazon sent me a refurbished unit (Amazon will only give you a refurbished unit even if you only had your unit for two months) I am still experiencing the same problem and have researched and this topic and I am not the only one. I am so disappointed in the Silk Browser. I side loaded Google Chrome last night and cross fingers so far so good.

Reviews.Title: So Glad I bought this!
Reviews.Author: Marsha Goddard
Reviews.Content: My new Kindle Fire is great! I can store multiple books AND play games on this one unit. Only disappointment is in the apps available.

Reviews.Title: Better than an iPad for a lot less
Reviews.Author: Guy W. Shoemaker
Reviews.Content: Good-bye iPad!!  Much stabler, great screen, does everything the iPad did for me plus I can get my subscriptions on a device I actually like.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 8.9
Reviews.Author: lildeb
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet.  It is small enough to fit anywhere but large enough to play games, enjoy movies and see my e-mail.  As I am getting older i thought a larger tablet was a good idea...I was right.  Will recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Useful for Entertainments and for Traveling
Reviews.Author: beverly cooper
Reviews.Content: More memory for book and music lover.Easy access to email and magazine without problems and sign-inAutomatically download game, music, TV series(other than amazon prime)Clear and cyber screen

Reviews.Title: love it better than Ipad
Reviews.Author: P. NARAYANAN
Reviews.Content: So I'm an apple fan boy, I have an iPad, iPhone, macbook.. I went into Best Buy to buy a iPad mini, then i checked out amazon kindle fire hd.. I was certainly blown up by the product. I know from content perspective, it's not clean as apple store, or fire os is better than ios. But who cares, I get mostly the same contents, and love to read on kindle fire HDX. the best part is the sheer light weight of the device, it is incredibly light. you could certainly hold it with one hand and use it most of the times. The screen resolution is far superior that iPad. So far I have been using it for 2 days, and I love it.  Buy it for 339, you won't be disappointed. It's cheaper than iPad mini. so It's not even that hard.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire 8.9 hdx
Reviews.Author: Dodie
Reviews.Content: I chose only three stars on this device because I have had a few problems with it so far. I need to use the May day soon, haven't really had time. It randomly shuts off or locks up. It does not have to reboot but I still find it somewhat annoying. And the sound is not as good as my old kindle fire hd 7 inch. It's a little hard to hear sometimes. But I do love how the kindle fires are set up. If these problems are fixed, this would be the best tablet ever!

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: Gerald Lacerda Sr.
Reviews.Content: I like it very much except It needs to let you have access to the Google play store. That would make it perfect. That is the reason I don't buy Apple products. If I buy something you should have no right to control what I put on it. You did not give it to me for free. I can side load some stuff, but the play store won't work due to it being blocked. That is a major drawback. This is my 2nd one and probably my last due to the app issue.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HDX
Reviews.Author: Deborah
Reviews.Content: I rated this product as 5 stars because I can do anything I desire and it is portable.I like (love) this product because of many positive factors.  I can do anything I desire and take it anywhere.  I can read my eBooks' at home, in the car, at school, etc.  I can listen to music, watch TV, watch videos, play games, and utilize apps for other businesses such as Internet programs on my computer and laptop.  It has quick to access technical support at any time with the 'Mayday' button.  My Kindle has access to wireless sites anywhere in my state, country, and the world.  The Kindle Fire HDX is everything I could expect for a portable device.  Therefore, there really is not any reason right now for me to dislike my Kindle.  There is only one negative aspect about my Kindle Fire HDX.  It does not come with any instructions on how to use the Kindle.
